name: Idaho Botanical Garden
address: 2355 N Old Penitentiary Rd, Boise, ID 83712, USA
reviews: In spring the flowers are in bloom everywhere.  Definitely a place to go for a simple date to walk and talk.  If photography is your thing there are many different types of flowers you can take pictures of.  My favorite though is winter when everything is lit up with millions of Christmas lights.  The people are friendly the line to get in is reasonable and it just looks amazing.

Good family fun! I always get my entire family together for our traditional walk through the Winter Garden Aglow. What a treat to find some talented young people spinning fire set to music, with a yuletide theme! That was our favorite part this year. We love the musicians who played carols down below, as well.

The Gardens light displays were absolutely beautiful.  They do a fantastic job using all of the space to create an amazing family friendly place to take in the beauty of the Christmas season.  Traffic gets pretty crazy so I highly recommend going earlier than later.  They also do a great job of having drinks for both little kids and big kids.

No matter what season you come it's always beautiful.  On this particular occasion it was during the winter and I went to the Winter Garden aglow event.  The lights were absolutely impressive and it was just staggering to me the sheer amount of work that must have got into making this event as amazing as it was.  I give definite kudos to all the volunteers who were willing to stand out in the cold to make a real difference to the people who came.  Thanks!

I always love the Idaho Botanical Gardens! Whether it's Winter Garden Aglow, music in the gardens, or a good friend's wedding, the Botanical Gardens are the perfect spot to hang out. Beautiful. Calming. Refreshing. Worth checking out.

name: Old Idaho Penitentiary Site
address: 2445 Old Penitentiary Rd, Boise, ID 83712, USA
reviews: This is a very informative and interesting museum. I found it very sad, but it is pretty cool to see how differently prisoners were treated, and how much our current prisons have improved. It is a great place to take people of all ages, if a place is for older people, they will advise you against bring kids there. The staff is very responsible. My over all favorite part of this was seeing Dennis the Cat's grave. It is so sweet that there was a cat for people to love! I would definitely go here again!

My Wife and I did the guided tour here and it was Awesome! So much history for Boise and so many stories we got to hear. The architecture within the walls was amazing and to hear the back story made the tour all come together. If you are looking for a fun and informative activity go check out The Old State Pen.

This was a surprisingly awesome stop in Boise. We have been to Alcatraz and other places like this, but really appreciated the openness of our experience, as well as an amazing arms museum donated by J Curtis Earl. This happens to be one of the nation’s largest collections of historic arms and military memorabilia, so WELL worth the visit!!

Plan to spend 2hrs for a quick visit.. but we would recommend planning for a four (4) hour stop here. Plenty to see!!

Neat to see a piece of history. Traveling exhibit of weapons when we went was really neat to see all in one place. Would have received more stars if more access to buildings was available. But what was open to the public was fun to see!

Loved this self guided tour. Walked around for three hours.  Thinking wondering what 10 years would feel like in such a place.  The sad life there day after day. Crazy sad.  Put live in a different perspective for a few hours. 

The arms museum was awesome.  Worth the moony even if your not interested in the prison.  And stories.

name: Kathryn Albertson Park
address: 1001 N Americana Blvd, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews: Free parking, right in the city and beautiful park. Lots of families come here to take photos so the park is most enjoyable on week days when less people are here. You will get to see some pretty off trails and wildlife walking around here.

Directly across the street from Ann Morrison park, Kathryn Albertson park is full of wildlife if you take the time to quietly enjoy it. Multiple walking paths make each trip a slightly different experience if you pick alternate routes. On this trip we found a deer just off the trail.
I love taking my children here for seasonal pictures. I also enjoy walking my dog here. Been coming here for 10+ yrs. We cannot wait for the upgrade! 😁
Perfect park to take photos. So many beautiful trees and bridges that make wonderful backdrops. The path is perfect for walking or just looking for the turtles.

Beautiful park! The people who come here are rude. No one stops and waits for you if you are taking pictures and just geta in the way or ruins the shot. 
Great walking and nature enjoying views.

name: Julia Davis Park
address: 700 S Capitol Blvd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: This is a great park. Lots of old trees, big open grassy areas, large rose garden, picnic tables, pond with paddle boats in the warmer months, pavilions, tennis courts, the zoo where you can get a free peek at the giraffes, nice restrooms and the greenbelt along the river. Art museum and history museums all right there also!

Julia Davis Park is a local WONDER to BEHOLD. Stop by the main entrance where her sign is and look at your compass. What do the DEGREES EAST tell you? There is MORE there than meets the eyes. A lot of thought has gone into this natural inter city OASIS. CAN YOU DIVINE WHAT IT IS? It's right there STARING you in the face!
We tried twice today, Feb 1, 2030 for the visit the the Boise zoo free event. Unfortunately, both times we circled the parking lot and found no spots to park.  Hope it was fun for all who made it in🐢

The clean up crew were friendly and welcoming. They helped point us in right direction. The garden was very pretty and offered so many diff roses :) the garden is in the midst of a lot of surroundint attractions. A art museum a zoo and a black history museum. There was no fee to attend the rose garden.
Great park for walking and enjoying the trees. The park is huge and has a little something for everyone. The paddle boats in the spry and summer are a fun treat for kids.

name: Zoo Boise
address: 355 Julia Davis Dr, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Coming from Dallas & having memberships to both the Dallas and Ft. Worth zoos was a bit of a shock, but now that it's our zoo, we love Zoo Boise. The expansion with the African exhibit is fantastic. I wish they would've sprung for non-reflective glass, but otherwise very well done. My kids love the zoo and we go a few times a month. We especially like when the keepers or student volunteers are out and give us a little extra information. My kids also love feeding the giraffes and the Sloth Bear. Can't wait to see the continued improvements.

My family had an absolutely fantastic time at the zoo. It's so big and the enclosures are all so so so nice. There are inside and outside ones when it's cold and the prices are AWESOME!!! They have season passes that my family will definitely be getting. There's also an area that's fantastic for kids with a little play area and what not. Great for adults and kids

An INCREDIBLE PLACE TO BE. NATURE NEVER LOOKED SO AWESOME! Stare into the snow leopards eyes if you dare! You'll FEEL the wild side and KNOW you WILL NEVER compete. Her tail the longest of ANY big cat and the FOX WOLF, really can read your mind. If you are starving, the Pretzels with cheese by the merry-go-round ROCK!

This zoo has some really cool features but I'm pretty disgusted at the size of some of their exhibits. Instead of working on additions, they ought to be working on giving more space to some of their prisoners.  Sorry, not sorry. Do better, Zoo Boise. Compassion over profits, please. Some of your souls look so sad. Please give them more room and enrichment.

Me and my wife had a good time at the zoo. I think the price is reasonable for how many animals and exhibits they have. It would be nice if some of the exhibits were a little more presentable but not that big of a deal.

name: Ann Morrison Park
address: Ann Morrison Park, 1000 S Americana Blvd, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews: Love this park, it's beautiful! Very spacious, which is great because a lot of people enjoy it. Great playground for kids, and then green belt is right there. And will take you anywhere. Also has a great spot for your dogs to play. Everyone should visit this park!

Dog Island is one of the best dog parks I’ve ever been to. If you have an issue with a dog or person, there’s enough space on the island to go to a separate part. It’s great for throwing balls, too, since there is so much space! It’s really a great addition to the park.

It's a huge park where many different activities can be done at the same time and people can still have some private space for picnics or reading a book. Dog Island is a freaking awesome dog park!! Best one in Boise hands down!! 😊

OMGOSH! I went in the RAIN and it was fabulous! You HAVE to see this. Sculptures that are so detailed. Just amazing. I didn't see much of anything because they were working on some house that is usually open to visitors and moved another. But the roses, just gorgeous and great photo ops.

Dog park was pretty good. Aside from nowhere to get water besides poopie water in the ponds. So bring your own clean water for your dog(s). Only super negative was the homeless drinking a case of beer outside the dog park area and the drug deal I witnessed but hey welcome to Boise

name: Freak Alley Gallery
address: 210 N 9th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: The art changes once every month or so. Some has symbolic meaning, others are creative expression. It's so amazing to see the different types of creations people have to offer.

I couldn't help but smile and gawp at the wonderful and poignant artworks sprawled all over this excellent alleyway. Rain or shine, take the time to swing by and check it out. Watch out for cars (it's still a road, albeit not busy) and check out the Instagram tags of the creators of your favorite pieces.
I love Freak Alley! Such an awesome collection of amazing artwork mixed in with old, rustic buildings, emergency fire escapes and cracking red brick.

Gotta love that artists have a place to express themselves anywhere. Boise does a great job of providing a lot of space for artists to do just that. Keep doing what you do. Favorite is the MLK piece. It's a clean walk and very accessible.

Super neat place. It is just an alleyway, but man is there some absolute talent showcased. Its located super conveniently and is also a pretty neat place to snag pictures, unfortunately while we were strolling through, a freak hailstorm with light started and our visit was cut short.

name: Camel's Back Park
address: 1200 Heron St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Great place to spend with friends and family. Tennis courts, sand volleyball, park for the little ones, body-weight outdoor gym, and a huge green space to play in the grass. There’s also a really steep hill (that looks like a camel’s back) that a lot of people run up and down. There’s also some trails tucked behind that is fun to do if you’re looking for a nice stroll in the hills.

A great place to take a walk or a hike. The work that they have done on the hillside to keep the main trail is amazing. So great that they were able to preserve this for future generations. The Hyde Park Street Fair in September is s huge hit. Best event of the kind in Boise!
Really nice park to go to. Great for hiking my boyfriend and I love to bring our dog up the hill and let her run around. Beautiful view of the city up there.

Boise is the City of Trees, but you don't really notice it unless you climb up into the foothills and look out over the city. It's there that you realize, "Oh, I guess we really do live in a forest." Camel's Back is a wonderful place to do that. Don't be daunted by the sheer straight face climb. There's also a much easier route to the top around the side. The park itself is also beautiful, idyllic.

A nice destination in a fun part of Boise. We went up the steep side of the hill first and then along the ridge, finally finding our way back to the main part of the park along a less steep route. After exploring the park itself, we went around the base of the hill to the other side to walk into Hull's Gulch. A short walk that day, but we'll be back!

name: Aquarium Of Boise
address: 64 N Cole Rd, Boise, ID 83704, USA
reviews: This is such a small and cute interactive aquarium! The staff is so friendly and really engages with the customers no matter the age. Plenty of hands on activities in the tide pools available. I enjoyed being able to touch the rays and feed them. The staff is very knowledgeable and is happy to answer questions. Though small, this aquarium is perfect for a small adventure.

Giving three stars because my daughter had a great time, but the staff didn't tell us a few things that they should have. They didn't  tell us that we had to buy the food at the front desk so we were walking around for a while wondering where to but it. Would have been nice if they just told us that if we wanted to feed them to just buy it then instead of going back to the front. Apparently paying with cash is cheaper, we only know this after coming back to buy the food and someone was paying to get in with cash and they said, "since you're paying with cash you saved.." Its quite small and not a lot to see but it was decent.
This is such a great place to take kids. They have a very safe setup where even little kids can see and (where allowed) touch fish and rays. Very interactive and entertaining.
This is the best aquarium I have been to and that's saying quite a bit. I loved how many interactive touch tanks there were and feeding the birds was so much fun. Definitely worth the visit!
Absolutely worth every penny! So many things to see! We spent easily two hours and it flew by. Can't wait to go back!

name: Discovery Center of Idaho
address: 131 W Myrtle St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: We enjoyed Adult Night at the Discovery Center of Idaho.  We met three other couples to enjoy a night of learning while sipping on drinks.  Lost Grove and the T-Rex Drinks were awesome!  Overall we had a great time and we hope to attend another event soon.  I highly recommend it for your next date night in Boise!

Cool place for kids to learn about science, technology, engineering and math.  Not quite as cool as I recall from when I was a kid, but my children 4-5 always have a blast when visiting.  New exhibits with legos and new tech are fun and interactive.  Birthday party setup is nice and allows for private access to the facilities for an hour or so.  Liquid nitrogen ice cream is pretty good as well!

Where your two-year-old can roar like a T-Rex! So much fun just amazing place. There is no reason not to come to the Discovery center of Idaho! Make sure you get the family pass it is well worth the money.

I originally put 4 stars by mistake! I absolutely love the Discovery Center. I have been coming here since high school (over 10 years!). I am a massage therapist, and most recently I came here with some other massage therapists for the Bodies Exhibit. So fascinating and a really good way to see all the muscles I work on every day!

We had our organization's winter celebration at the Discovery Center for about 100 people, and it went great! Not only did all of the guests have a great time, Cynthia (the event coordinator), went above and beyond to make sure our event was a success. She helped coordinate with the many vendors that we had at the event, as well as met with me several times leading up to the event to make sure we had everything we needed. We plan on using the Discovery Center for future gatherings. 10/10 recommend for large company events, and it's a great place to visit overall!

name: Idaho Anne Frank Human Rights Memorial
address: 777 S 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: This place was a quaint comfy park like atmosphere. Students were there studying and writing papers. Birds were chirping. The statues available and water falls they have installed were clean. Info on some of the statues. For all ages! Def worth stopping by and taking a looksie :)
What an experience, so much to look at & read about Ann Frank, very well done! Definitely a place not to miss, especially the spring & summer.

My family visited from Toronto. My sister and her son just made a fuss about how great this place is. Her husband is Jewish, so human rights is really close to home. They read all the plaques and came away with a deeper understanding of people who have contributed to human kind from many ages and counties.

A really nicely laid out outdoor memorial with beautiful stone work and paths, located right next to the Boise River and near downtown Boise. The memorial has many quotes from various civil rights leaders that sort of jump out at you as you walk through the memorial. Also includes a central statue of Anne Frank, imagery of other civil rights leaders and icons, and a memorial for historical genocides. However, it was unfortunate that all of the various civil rights leaders and movements were represented, EXCEPT any mention of the LGBTQ civil rights struggle or any mention of Stonewall or Harvey Milk. It seems this needs to be added, as it was conspicuously left out. It didn't seem complete to me.

If you really want to think about the impact of your life and the difference you can make this is a great place to be. You come to appreciate your rights and privileges and gain an understanding of what others have gone through. Definitely a must see if you're in Boise

name: Julius M. Kleiner Memorial Park
address: 1900 N Records Ave, Meridian, ID 83642, USA
reviews: Really nice park any time of the year. Small and short disc golf course but great for teaching the sport! Pond is always full of ducks, and the playground has an activity for all age groups! Definitely our favorite in the treasure valley

In the summer we do workouts here with Fit4Mom. The park is always well maintained and looks so pretty. It is never too crowded which is nice and they put on a lot of events. Walking around even when we are not working out is so nice and relaxing. The park for the kids is nice and updated with lots for the kids to do and even though the splash pad is pretty simple it’s still fun. I like how it’s close to the village too so we can walk over and have coffee there if we wanted too.

A magnificent park. If you ever need to shoot a film set in the future (in Idaho, of all places) this is the place to do it. Weird/fantastic modern art everywhere, beautiful paths, lots of food nearby, fantastic through-and-through.

Park was great, but it was more fun to see people driving 40+ and revving their engines loud so that others can run out of the way. If you need an area to get the blood flowing faster, then this is one of them. And because I have never noticed any officials there, I'm assuming that some have permissions to go higher than the signs states. 
Otherwise, it's pretty decent
The park was very nice.  My wife was super impressed with how many bathrooms there are and how clean they were.

name: Settlers Park
address: 3245 N Meridian Rd, Meridian, ID 83646, USA
reviews: Love this park! Lot's of space for everyone! We come here often to run/walk our dog. We enjoy attending public events and also hosting our own family events here. Great atmosphere here ☺
This park is always so full of life. They have a wonderful splash , climbing, swings and more for the kids. What seems like miles of grass to play with your dogs, fly a kite or just run!

Loving this park. There is so much to do: fishing, tennis court, climbing rock for kids and two playgrounds for different ages,  splash park in summer and little music station for kids. This is our family favorite park in Meridian
This is the coolest person ever. Take your kids in the summer because they have water play. Dog-friendly as long as you're on a leash

10 years ago Settlers park was the best park, with a huge variety. But over the years with the hot summer sun, everything now just looks faded. The large play area for some reason has a back entrance to it, so if you are standing on the ground while your child is on the play equipment, and they suddenly run towards the back entrance, you have to go ALL the way around the equipment to get them. Just seems poorly designed. 

It's also almost always super crowded. To the point of annoyance. I understand public parks are popular, and never expect the park to myself. But it just always seems like there's a lack of parking and too many kids playing to keep a good eye on my multiple kids.

name: Puzzle Effect - Boise
address: 8249 W Overland Rd #140, Boise, ID 83709, USA
reviews: Such a fun experience. The staff is super welcoming and helpful and you can tell they like their job. The themes are well thought out. Great for team-building with your co-workers or a fun family game night.

My first time to experience an Escape Room was great at Puzzle Effect in Boise. Thankfully we had some frequent escapers to guide us and help us find what we should be looking for. I can’t wait to do another one!  

The staff member at Puzzle Effect was so helpful in explaining ahead of time what we should expect and was so supportive in knowing most of us were first-timers. He also was so enthusiastic about us finishing in close to record time. We ROCKED!!!

Absolutely fantastic experience from the moment I called with questions to the moment we left,  great staff. Very fun time in our escape room and I’ve done escape rooms before. I will definitely be going back!! Our daughter had her birthday here as well and had a great time with her friends.

The puzzles were extremely challenging and lots of fun. It was worth flying across the country just to play the game.  Finishing with 4 minutes left made us all feel proud!
Great facility- very nice “guide.”

This was my first experience with an escape room and it was so different from what I had expected! I was thinking it would be some low budget not so scary spook alley with a couple puzzles. But it was very tastefully done with super thought provoking puzzles all relating to a central theme which in our case was ancient Chinese mysticism. And high quality, high tech props. Katelyn was really great and made sure to keep an eye on us through cameras, and if we got stuck she put up helpful hints on the TV screen in the room. It cost $25 per person and you have one hour to complete all the puzzles relating to one large puzzle. It was a lot of fun and I would recommend it to anyone!

name: Idaho State Museum
address: 610 Julia Davis Dr, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: A great example of a state prison.  A very informative tour laid out with videos and interpretive signs. You can walk all around this prison from the general population halls, Siberia, the isolation cells to the hanging room. It is very sobering as you peak into the past. There are some beautifully tended gardens on the grounds as well as a  building that is just weaponry from the past. There are interactive features of your tour to enjoy as well.

The remodeled museum is an absolute masterpiece! It is highly interactive and built in rooms that make it easy to manage groups of children. I went with a group of 4th graders and they were entertained for 2 hours. I felt proudly that it greatly represents our amazing state. It will easily impress visitors and locals. A must see!

High quality museum and staff! I was greeted by Alyson (with a Y, she said), she was super welcoming and kind, she stood up to greet us. She engaged with my kids making sure they felt important. As a leader in customer service for over 15 years, I recognize good service. Alyson has it. 
This museum is excellent! My kids loved the interaction aspect of the place. TownBoom was so fun! My kids loved the dynamics of the train.  Will visit again.

It was a fun place for our whole family. There was a decent amount to see and do and our young kids were fairly well entertained the whole time. There were kids educational play areas which worked well for us and still deeper content for adults. There is a good mix of digital presentations and traditional displays.

So much information, I suggest going for a good 5 hours to appreciate everything they have there 💚 I missed out on 1 large room and I was there a good 3.5 hours trying to read as much as possible. They include a lot of different topics and one room changes periodically. There are MANY hands on interactive things to do for children or people like me who love touching things 🤣

name: Basque Museum and Cultural Center
address: 611 W Grove St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Interesting place. Go.amd learn something interesting
If you are enjoying Boise's downtown bath district, please make sure and check out this museum for regional and local historical information.
Beautiful place. Didn't take the official tour but will soon!!!
Great way to learn about the Basque in Boise. I wished there would have been a video to show the dances performed at the annual festival for those of us not fortunate to attend in person.
Great space! Very welcoming. Would recommend.

name: MK Nature Center - Idaho Fish and Game
address: 600 S Walnut St, Boise, ID 83712, USA
reviews: Wow, this is definitely worth a visit! Well designed and maintained nature area loaded with streams, ponds, viewing areas and informative signs. I loved the sturgeon pond! It was a little tough to see with the reflection on the water, but thankfully the sturgeon were hanging out at the contrasting white sand bottom, they were maybe between 4-6 feet long. Quite impressive! Thanks for creating such a great space, and its is free to visit!

It's been several years since I'd been here. (No longer have little kids.) My husband and I had decided to go here in order to get a little walking in. They've really cleaned it up. They spruced up all the viewing areas. There's local art and several fun little kid activities. People of all ages were enjoying the spring day. I want to go back when it is really spring so that I can see what it's like with the butterflies and hummingbirds.

Just for everyone's info, the nature center building is closed for remodeling for the next couple of weeks. You can still take the walk on the nature trail, which I recommend. It is amazing. Also you should plan a trip to the nature center after the reopening. Your whole family will enjoy your time spent together.
I absolutely love taking my boys here! It's so much fun and so very beautiful. lots of flora and fauna! 🌱🌲🦌🦝🦊

I took my children here on a "field trip" and they had SO much fun. I loved how natural it all felt, that we could roam freely and learn along the way. The staff is incredibly sweet and helpful. We will be returning next year for sure!

name: Barber Park
address: 4049 S Eckert Rd, Boise, ID 83716, USA
reviews: We love Barber. It's our starting point for all our advetures! Walks, bike rides, floating, playing at the park, and just exploring and enjoying nature!

Very nice park! Wife and I visiting our daughter and son in law. We have NOTHING like this in Arkansas. We have trails and mountains in the north western part of the state but nothing like this! And it’s just a 5 min drive from their home in Harris Ranch 😃 beautiful park, beautiful city, beautiful state!!!!
We love this park! :-) such a wonderful place to take our dogs :-)

I was able to find nooks along the river that were private and secluded, despite the park being packed with folks. Lots of beautifully mature trees, diving ducks, and fisherman on the east side provided a wonderful backdrop for the day. Very clear water that you can wade across, but there is a swift current here. Great just for a picnic. Lots of dogs. A great mix of sun and shade, so that you can cool down a bit when necessary.

If you are FLOATING THE BOISE RIVER this is the spot to launch your rafts. There are air hoses conveniently located by the launch spot and there is an outfitter with raft/tube rentals available as well. A snack shack with drinks, shaved ice and food is usually open during daylight ours as well. There is also a series of trails, both paved (bicycles, strollers) and dirt for exploring the park. I found a beautiful dock to view the river and watch the floaters coming down. I will be bringing family and friends to this spot and floating the river as well!

name: Idaho Military History Museum
address: 4692 W Harvard St, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews: The Idaho military museum was awesome. It is small but has really great potential especially if people keep up the donations.  They have display cases from different wars through out time and it was really cool being able to see and read about our history. Both in Idaho and around the world.  If you have not been I would highly recommend it.  Admission is also free so bring a couple a dollars to donate!

I really enjoyed looking at the pictures and models of the naval ships. I also really liked being able to get up close and personal with a MIG29 and a F4 Phantom. So cool! Love to see my tax dollars put to good use :)
It's nice for a small museum. However don't go expecting a lot of exhibits and the gift shop is lackluster at best. But it's free admission and for free it's worth it.

I personally love machinery and mechanical weaponry. There's something enjoyable about the power and steel of these machines. This is a great time if you like tanks/airplanes. Some little kids don't find it interesting so keep it mind this isn't for everyone.
I loved it. There is so much to see at your own pace. So much to learn and it is great for kids. Friendly knowledgeable staff too!!! Great place to spend a few hours learning.

name: Hyde Park
address: 1413-1620 N 13th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Beautiful Park nestled against the Boise foothills just a mile or so behind the state capitol. Play set for the kids, an outdoor Gym, Mature trees, open space to play, tennis courts, hiking, BBQ area and more! A most visit when in Boise or the Hyde Park area!

This area known as Hyde Park is a historic, old shopping area which is been renovated into restaurants. There are a few very nice little stores which typically sell more unique items. There are various shops like:  ice cream shop, pizza places, bars, Mexican food, gas station which sells groulers, breakfast places, and several good restaurants. It is very walking friendly and dog friendly.  Several places to park with one area with pay parking.  It is a short walk to Camel's back park.  It is located in the historic north end of Boise.

Nice to look at the houses, but the rumours are not true. THEY DO NOT GIVE OUT FULL SIZE CANDY BARS! It is ALOT of walking, LONG lines to wait in at EVERY house, and definitely a one and done kind of experience.  Been there, done that, dont need to do it again. Plus there are TONS of people, it is hard to walk on the sidewalk, if you have a stroller you are walking in the street which means whoever is pushing the stroller cannot be with the kiddos. Thankfully the street is closed to vehicles.
It's a fun, cute little historic neighborhood place to go for dinner, or to wander around, and then over to the park.
Pretty cool park. I enjoyed going up to table top. Hyde Park Streetfair was also there. It was very crowded and very granola hippie.

name: Re-POP Gifts
address: 210 N 10th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: The owner is so sweet and nice! Her and her husband make their own props and help you take pictures with them. It's a needs paradise! It seriously feels like a mini-Comic Con inside.
Unique store! Millie was so kind to box and wrap the t-shirt we were giving as a gift. No extra charge for it either. I'm definitely going to have to POP back in from time to time!
The staff here is very nice and knowledgeable. They have a lot of prints by local artists. Definitely one of the most fun shopping experiences I have had. Get ready to nerd out!

This place is so awesome! There is truly something for everyone, whether you’re into books, video games, movies, TV, anything pop culture related, they have it! They also have a lot of artwork and jewelry and patches from local artists. Prices didn’t seem outrageous in my opinion and the person behind the counter was polite and helpful.
Super fun and cute store packed with all sorts of nerdy/pop-culture gifts. There's also a nice selection of local Idaho-souvenir type items. Places like this are what make downtown fun!

name: Quinn's Pond
address: 3150 W Pleasanton Ave, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Nice park gets crowded during the day. Early mornings and late evenings are the best times to go. Wheelchair-accessible bathrooms nice River area nice ponds. Idaho river sports is right next to it if you want to rent some water gear.
Awesome place for summer fun! You can paddle board, kayak or float around. There's a great kids area that even offers life jackets to borrow.

Needs more shade but otherwise great for puttering around on kayaks and paddle boards. Snack bar close by, restrooms, Sandy beaches and a few grassy areas. I was surprised at how many people were there and parking was somewhat of a problem as the day progressed. Enjoyable all the same...we will go again.

I'm still in awe of how beautifully the whole huge area was put together. The many array of things to do there or simply relax is impressive. Amazingly beautiful & welcomeing. Thank all of those that made it happen. Thank you so very much.
Great time with friends, paddle boarding and sitting on the beach. Lots of fun!

name: Hyatt Hidden Lakes Reserve
address: 5301 N Maple Grove Rd, Boise, ID 83704, USA
reviews: My kids and I walk here as least once a week during sunny days. Spring is in the air and we're excited to be visiting this place again soon! Down falls: There's no dogs allowed and often towards the end of Autumn the path gets over grown.

Awesome little nook!! It's a great place to take a walk around some peaceful wilderness. There's trails around the whole area and a nice little bridge with some nature info that, when water is high, it's surrounded by water. There's usually some ducks or geese year round so watch out for them.
Amazing little place right in Boise. Great walking trails. Beautiful views.

This trail was so beautiful! It really is a hidden gem, I totally didn’t expect it to be as big as it was. There are informative signs all throughout the trail telling you tidbits about the area. It was really cool. Definitely going to go back here! It’s also a very easy hike, suitable for all skill levels in my opinion.
A nice and quiet hidden spot. Good for going for a walk and feeling like youre far removed from the city when you're actually right in the middle of it

name: Idaho Black History Museum
address: 508 Julia Davis Dr, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Look forward to some multimedia additions. Amazing location and friendly patrons.
Excellent local museum host whose mother is an Idaho State representative. Great information and friendly.
A sobering reminder of the overwhelming struggles for part of our population.  Interesting stories and information on a variety of subject areas.
The Museum director Phillip is great about answering questions. And also good about doing tours for school programs.

A definite must see when coming to Boise, I am of the belief that all people from any walk of life or ethnic backgrounds should visit such an important and Vidal part of the American  historical experience.

name: Boise Depot
address: 2603 W Eastover Terrace, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews: The Boise Train Depot is a classic spot for a family outing or photography sessions! I’ve photographed a few different sessions here, from weddings to seniors. The Depot is beautiful year round, especially with the view of downtown Boise! It’s particularly pretty if you go in Spring or Fall with all of the flowers and plants around. If you’re looking for an intimate, classy wedding venue, I’d definitely recommend the Depot! I’ve photographed multiple weddings here and each one is able to transform the space into something unique. The staff always seems on top of things and there’s a cute bridal suite for the people to get ready in! Plus, they usually allow you to go up in the bell tower!

Beautiful train, depot, and clock tower. The steam train is beautiful and big and great for pictures. The inside of the depot has nice original benches and lights, and original bells (4 of them) in the clock tower. Good place for photo ops

Great place to go for a piece of Boise history. Beautiful park to get pictures of or views of downtown. The depot hosts different interesting events during the year that are cool to check out. If that's not enough and Pokemon Go is your jam there are a lot of stops and a gym.
One of the most beautiful places I like to visit! Great for pictures and just to relax. Inside the depot is absolutely magical and there is nothing about this amazing place that I don't love! 😊

Boise Depot is beautifully restored and has historic displays from the era of early train travel.  My great grandfather was a conductor with Union Pacific based out of Boise Depot.  It is wonderful to share that history with my children, his great, great grandchildren.
Ride the elevator to the top of the Bell tower for a panoramic view of Boise.

name: Table Rock
address: 3199 E Table Rock Rd, Boise, ID 83712, USA
reviews:
Go God.

Folks, it's a cross that's been there forever. It isn't hurting anyone. Table Rock is a lovely hike from any direction. There's a great view of a beautiful city. What else do you need?

Table Rock is a great place to go for a view of the valley. It’s peaceful and relaxing. Park at the bottom and hike all the way up or drive up and park near the summit and take a short walk. Great for the whole family.

One of the best easily accessible hikes in Boise! I HIGHLY recommend a sunset bike for this one or you can drive all the way to the top (almost any car is capable), pull out a picnic, and watch the sun drop below the horizon. The back side trail the golf course is perfect for mountain bikers or hikers who want steeper grades. The main front side trails are great for kids and families or those looking for a less strenuous incline. At the top, the view of the city, foothills, and landscape is hard to beat; if you haven’t been- go now!

They recently limited parking, closed the small lot at the bottom of the hill, and have signs up threatening to charge you with trespassing. They also threaten to have your car towed. Used to be the best place in boise for an afternoon hike, now it is the last place to go.

I WAS BORN AT ST. LUKES HOSPITAL DOWNTOWN AND I HAVE LIVED IN IDAHO FOR 36 YEARS... IN 36 YEARS, I HAVE NEVER BEEN TO TABLE ROCK AND UNTIL THIS MONTH I HAVE NEVER TRULY BEEN ABLE TO SAY FROM MY HEART THAT I BELIEVE IN JESUS BUT THANK YOU LORD THAT THIS DAY I CAN!!! I LOVED IT AND I LOVE MY HOMETOWN!!! GOD BLESS EVERYONE WHO LIVES HERE AND STRIVES TO DO GOOD FOR OTHERS!!! MOST IMPORTANTLY GOD PLEASE BLESS EVERYONE WHO IS LOST, FOUND, OR TRYING TO FULLY SURRENDER!!! WE ARE ALL YOUR CHILDREN AND JESUS IS THE ONE TRUE KING OF ALL!!! THANK YOU GOD FOR YOUR ONE AND ONLY SON JESUS CHRIST!!! THANK YOU JESUS FOR YOUR ULTIMATE SACRIFICE TO SAVE ALL OUR BROKEN LIVES HERE ON EARTH!!! I AND ALL OTHER BELIEVERS PATIENTLY WAIT TO BE WITH YOU ETERNALLY IN HEAVEN!!! PLEASE GIVE US THE GIFTS AND THE KNOW HOW TO USE THEM SO THAT WE MAY STAND RIGHTEOUS THROUGH JESUS AND MAY HE USE HIS HOLY SPIRIT IN US TO HELP ALL OTHERS IN NEED OF HELP AND SALVATION!!! I PRAY THESE WORDS IN YOUR NAME JESUS CHRIST, THANK YOU,  AND AMEN!!!!!!!

name: Veterans Memorial Park
address: 930 Veterans Memorial Pkwy, Boise, ID 83703, USA
reviews: Veterans Memorial Park is a lovely park that has something for the whole family! I photographed an engagement session there this Fall and the nature you can find was perfect. There are walking paths around the park which you can follow back into a more secluded area of the park. There were surrounding trees, plants, and a creek, all of which were fun to see while walking around. Everything was clean and there were multiple places to just sit and enjoy the view!
Huge park. I love the mix of manicured lawns and natural environment. The playground is great for the kids. The trail to the greenbelt is finally open and I love it!
Have always loved this place. Beautiful photo opportunities
My husband and I had our wedding reception here. Very clean park and we all had a great time. My kids and I come often to just wonder around and enjoy how beautiful it is.
There are some excellent pieces of equipment for children to play on, conveniently close to the restrooms, so no long walk to get kids to from the play area to the potty.

name: Bogus Basin Recreation Area
address: 2600 N Bogus Basin Rd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: We had a blast participating in summer activities here! There is something for literally everyone in the family. We took a group of six and some of the adults went hiking in the trails. The kids loved all the activities offered, but the highlight was the mountain coaster (and even the adults loved it!). Other activities included gem mining, rock climbing, tubing, and the trampoline. It’s a windy haul to get up there, but definitely worth it!

Bogus Basin is a ski resort residing near Boise, Idaho and has a good variety of tracks for all snow-based recreational activities such as skiing and snowboarding. There's tracks ranging from easy beginner tracks to harder professional tracks and makes very clear which is which through an easily decipherable color/shape system. There are also areas for more casual sports such as tubing. In conclusion Bogus Basin is an amazing ski resort for anyone looking to have some fun this winter.

It was great snow this season. Even when it was raining it’s always easy to for get about the daily things in life and just be able to relax in the mountains with your friends. This 2018-2019 season has been great and I’m sad to see it’s over

We always have a blast at Bogus Basin.  Depending on the snow year, the skiing is exceptional.  There are a good variety of ski runs with various difficulty levels.  Coach slope is great for beginners and cheap skiing.  Night ski slopes are well lit and fun.  All of this within a half hour from Boise.  Don't forget to get up there for mountain biking in the summer which is equally amazing!

I love this place. I know people knock it because the road is sketchy at times and it can get crowded. Bring the appropriate vehicle or take the shuttle, and avoid midday on the weekends and you'll be fine.  The Bogus basin staff is always helpful and courteous. They run two of their own snow plows to keep the road clear. They have added many enhancements the last couple of years. It's a pretty great place that's only 16 miles from downtown Boise.

name: The Peregrine Fund's World Center For Birds of Prey
address: 5668 W Flying Hawk Ln, Boise, ID 83709, USA
reviews: Such a cool place to see magnificent birds! They do showings with the owls so you can see them up close and personal! Not too crowded, and all the staff members were very friendly and welcoming.

This place is amazing! You have to visit it at least once if you are in the area. The number of different birds of pray is incredible. And there are times that you can get up close with many of the birds with the staff.

Just coffee shop is superb! All of the different coffees I've tried have been wonderful! They must have a great vendor for their pastries because two different times I've tried cinnamon rolls and each time I really enjoyed them. They are always pretty quick and very friendly and nice.

Wow! This was Avery be impressive place! If you have ever wanted to have a falcon graze the top of your head (literally) while it blasts past at high speeds, THIS IS YOUR PLACE!  It was so cool being so up close and personal with those birds. Plus their conservation efforts are absolutely amazing, considering we only have several falcon species alive still because of this organization. I will definitely go back some day on another trip to Boise.

Amazing, though you cannot touch birds (for good reasons). They have ones that can't be returned to the wild in a cabin sized "living space" (nothing like a cage) with plenty of room for each individual, with fake grass perches, water rocks and wood.
I saw 1 harpy eagle, some owl s

name: Idaho Museum of Mining and Geology
address: 2455 Old Penitentiary Road next to Old Penitentiary Entrance, Boise, ID 83712, USA
reviews: If you love rocks.... Great place to see Idaho rocks and geology maps. Rare specimens on display! Relatively small museum, information concentrated on gems often found in Idaho mountains, gem mining in Idaho history, and Idaho’s geological history. Look for Idaho Picture Jasper and Star Garnet— two beautiful gems. Learn where Star Garnet is found in Idaho... find “pictures” in pieces of Picture Jasper.

What a "Gem" of a museum! Very good interactive displays. Very knowledgeable staff. If you are interested in Idaho beauty and history, local geology, and our rich history of mining, meteorites, and a member built seismometer, this place is a must see!

Very cool this place is great for people who love learning about rocks and geology. 

They also have meteorites and information about a cool prehistoric shark.

The volunteers were very nice and helpful
The gift shop is really nice, and although the museum is very small, it has fun exhibits and a beautiful collection of fossils, meteorites, and minerals.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.

This museum is packed into a building on the grounds of the Old Idaho Penitentiary. Don't let the small size fool you. There's a lot to see. From the scientific to the historic, the geology, mineralogy and mining history of Idaho can be found inside. There are maps showing the terrain types. There are samples of many types of rock and mineral. Many exhibits are hands-on. There are things for both adults and kids. The staff are knowledgeable and very friendly. The day we went, there was no entrance fee, but we left a small donation, the museum is that good. There is a small gift shop. Note for wheelchairs and those with a fall risk: due to the age of the building, the floors are not always even. The ramps and lips and steps are marked.

name: MING Studios
address: 420 S 6th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: An acquaintance invited me to view his showing.  The showing was very good and he is an awesome host !!

Cool, interesting space. They host art, films, etc. but I was attending a phenomenal ballet/modern art performance. Not a terribly large venue, but well-suited for decent crowd, performers, art installation and booze/snacks.  It seems like a good nonprofit. Support art in Boise!!
MING is such wonderful gallery and space. MING contributes a wonderful gift to the collective arts and culture community in Boise by expanding our options with thoughtfully curated shows.

MING brings the highest caliber international artists to Boise and immerses them in the community for a significant period of time. Much more in store as MING expands its offerings: look for pop ups, weekly events, curated meals and frequent gatherings of Boise's creative community.
A great gallery space showing international artwork and hosting performances and events. Worth checking out!

name: Boise Whitewater Park
address: 3400 W Pleasanton Ave, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Beautiful area. Looking forward to coming back to Boise in July and spend more time here
Sweet Park in a great location.
Very pretty location, fun to watch the kayakers play in the water

The Whitewater Park has restored natural raparian systems along the Boise River and, at the same time, provided an extraordinary recreational amenity for the enjoyment of Treasure Valley residents as well as visitors from afar.
Chillin by the river and a stationary wave who knew!! Great spot to hang by the river!!

name: Eagle Island State Park
address: 165 Eagle Island Pkwy, Eagle, ID 83616, USA
reviews: Tubing is fun for all ages! I would definitely recommend it! It's so much fun to do the big group chains. It's also super clean and a cool place to walk around as well. There's a small park behind the tubing area that's actually really decent.

This place is great to take the family short drive and located in town!  The tubing staff is over the top nice which is hard to find these days. The booking process is great insured low wait time and not over crowding. Looking forward to try the other activities there this summer. My hope is this park stays as natural as it currently is. Shows the beautiful Idaho landscape

Tons of fun!! Great for first-time kids that might be a little nervous but still fun for those who like excitement! Great family event I even alone. I live that you don't have to walk up the hill as they have an escalator type way to get up to the top. 
Definitely recommend

Great disc golf course! Watch for walkers and be respectful always! Walkers please don't stand near metal baskets with chains! People will likely be by soon to throw hard peices of plastic directly where your are standing.

We have enjoyed a number of diverse activities at this park. A quiet picnic meal, large organized sponsored picnics as well as festivals, zip-lining and snow-tubing. The staff does a great hob keeping the place clean and available for all

name: Storey Park
address: 205 E Franklin Rd, Meridian, ID 83642, USA
reviews: What a nice park. I love that so much effort is being taken to construct these parks and make them inviting to come too. My thanks to you
Good music, family fun and fireworks.  Jad a great time as always.

It's a really great park, has a party area, decent jungle gym, it has swings and one of them is and adult and kid combo swing I've never seen one before. There is meridian pool and meridian speedway right next door as well.

Love how this park is very well taken care of. My mother-in-law and I stop here with lunch when we're in town doing business. And the only time my little girl eats all her lunch just so she can play here. LOVE IT HERE!
Fun little area for the kids, multiple slides and plenty of swings. It gets a little bit windy there, so dress a little warmly

name: Cassia Park
address: 4600 W Camas St, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews: This park has a very nice sidewalk to walk around in the summer. In the winter the sidewalks are dicey and I wish at times the park department would go around and check to see if they can de-ice the walk ways.
Cassia Park is a great place to walk your dog on leash. It has a beautiful, new tennis court and a fun playground for all ages. People in the neighborhood are really friendly.
I went to the park to watch a frisbee football game. We had a very good time. I think this is a good place to go for a good time.

Great little park tucked into a quiet neighborhood. Loads of room for any activity. Only downside would be numerous people have their dogs of leash, and lots of people don't clean up after their dogs. Watch your step!!
Great public park. Easy access for anybody who lives in "the bench" neighborhood. Clean tons of open space and awesome tennis courts.

name: The Military Reserve
address: 750 Mountain Cove Rd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: There needs to be more trash cans along the trails because the only one I found was deep in to the dog park area. Otherwise GREAT for all adventure lovers. Dogs are off leash so be cautious of course but how could you not want to roam with the animals?!
Very nice, me (and my dog) had fun for hours. The new bike park was very fun with features for those of all skill levels.
This is a great place for a ride or a hike.  Owels roost is a great trail if you are looking for something that's nice and scenic.
Great trails! Easy access to nature.

The Military Reserve is a little gem just outside downtown Boise. It is a great place for hiking and biking. Trails are marked well and we'll maintained. Some trails are dog off leash and others require dog on leash, so make sure to read the signs. During the early summer it may be a bit buggy, especially if there has been a lot of rain, but later in the summer it isn't bad.

name: Rhodes Skate Park
address: 1555 W Front St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: My 15yr old Nephew loves riding his scooter here. He can spend 5 or more hours and never gets board. We visit from California every summer and he makes friends and has never had trouble with the other skaters or scooter riders. I have spend many hours watching him and didn't see any reason to let him stay there alone. I liked the park, clean and lots of stuff 2 do tricks on.

Attended an x games event. Great event. Parking was available for free. Free children's entertainment provided. Vendors were available at event and free water. Truly a place for the community. Thank you
Had a great time.  My boys had fun with the big guys and they were all very helpful and supportive of my little guys.
Best Park around! Lots of cool events, and a great community area in the center of downtown.
Road to xgames just passed thru here not to long ago with some amazing competition.

name: Lucky Peak State Park
address: 9725 ID-21, Boise, ID 83716, USA
reviews: This lake used to be big enough for Boise and the surrounding area, but it's getting too crowded, unfortunately.  Still extremely beautiful scenery and tons of places to hike and explore, but if you're trying to ski on an average day in the summer, you'll have to go WAY out away from the park areas to get a little piece of your own lake.
Awesome place for a picnic, you can reserve large covered tables with grill or use one under one of the many trees. Handicap bathrooms are available. It's a $5 carload self fee.

A pretty park on the edge of Boise. Big viewing feature seems to be a hydroelectric plant with a dam and cormorants in residence. 

There is also a pond for bathing, restrooms and a trail for bikes and hiking that runs along the river. It's pretty but did not offer the hiking we were looking for. 

A state park there is a $5 entry fee.  The guard hit was not manned that day so it was on the honor system. Bring a pen!
Nice park except the dog friendly part is downstream the main swim park so turn in to this one first with a dog.
Great little close to Boise getaway. Also close to the reservoir, and Discovery Park, boating, fishing, trails and a short drive from Hilltop and the marina. Disc golf course and picnic spots.

name: Ivywild Park
address: 416 W Ivywild St, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews:
Reasonable prices, way better than the big water park. Great place for a family day. Great parking. 

3 slides, swimming test required, one that 2 people can go at once. 

Active lifeguard lessons, even saved a kid who couldn’t swim well while we were there! 

Food options available at a very affordable price! 

Not many tables, but a lot of grass and shade with the trees. 

Locker rooms with bathrooms and showers, men and women separated.

This is a wonderful park to take your children too and there is a water park during the hotter seasons. There are large fields for a verity of sport games. In addition to this there are a few tennis courts and several paths around the park. The best part is the entire area is clean, no trash, no animal poop, no graffiti, etc.. For those that play Pokémon go there are a couple of gyms at this location and a few poke stops.
Very clean and fun park! Tons to do and lots of space! Dog friendly!
Not great, but overall I liked it. They seem a bit stuck up about a few things and the price could be better for what it is. A pool and a slide.

Great swimming area for all ages. Concessions and entry fees are very reasonable. Great place for families on hot days. More tables and chairs would be nice but large grass areas to easily accommodate max capacity. Bring blanket or chairs for seating, if you need shade bring umbrellas because shade is very limited.

name: Boise Rose Garden
address: 670 Julia Davis Dr, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: A must stop for quintessential Boise touring. Mid summer is best.

One of my favorite places in Boise. It’s calm and peaceful. Filled with vibrant beautiful colors and the sweetest aroma. The fountains are an added bonus. I brought my mom here when she visited Boise and she loved it just as much as I did. A Boise must see
Better every time I go
Beautiful rose garden located close to downtown. Lot of activities during summer. Liked everything except pathways, which are covered with gooses defection especially in the fall season.
Beautiful flowers, and overall nice setting.  Near several museums and other interesting places in the city.  One note, watch where you step, lots of Canadian Geese around!

name: Children’s Museum of Idaho
address: 790 S Progress Ave, Meridian, ID 83642, USA
reviews: My almost 4 year old loved this place! If I wasn't pregnant right now I would have signed up for a year membership. If you plan on visiting this children's museum 5+ times a year it is worth getting the membership. At least for a small family. 2 people are included for the membership. I'm sure they have larger options as well.

The grandkids had such a great time! Thanks for entertaining them for 2-3 hours, even though it was raining and we couldn't go to the outdoor area... That was a bit if a disappointment, but we will be back for sure. One suggestion...I think you should allow at lease one adult in for free when you have 2 or more kids you're having to pay for to get in.

Absolutely fantastic place for kids! I have a 2 and 4 year old and they both had a wonderful time. There is a ton of things to play with and it is all educational to boot. Highly recommended. We got a year pass so we can go all we want.

We ended up getting a membership here and come almost once a week.  Our son (3.5) loves it. There is lots to do and see. They change things up a bit so there are new things.  It was a great place to host the 3 year birthday party also.

Wow, what a great place to take the kids! Extremely interactive with a very local feel. Each area and theme is sponsored by one or more Treasure Valley businesses. Displays are always changing too. This is definitely a place I would recommend getting a season pass! You won’t regret it!

name: Roaring Springs Water Park
address: 400 W Overland Rd, Meridian, ID 83642, USA
reviews: This place was awesome and perfect for littler kids and adults! Something for everyone and we will definitely be back!!!! The lazy river was great and long. 3 ft always so great for our daughter to float and stand any time. The wave pools got crowded but that's normal anywhere. The lines weren't that bad for slides considering it's the middle of summer. Very happy with our visit and the employees were all extremely friendly and very helpful!

So much fun and such a variety of activities for all ages and thrill levels. The Avalanche was the scariest and you can pretty much take the lazy river to the different entrances to all other attractions! And splurging on a cabana, you feel like royalty!

Really enjoy this place with the family,  fun, friendly staff. Pools to play with the kids and slides for adults. Yummy snacks or you can get a stamp at the door and go to the many restaurants nearby. A must place to visit in summer time.

For water park options in the treasure valley this is the place to be. It can be crowded but given it's the only major watermark around it deserves 4 stars in my book. Hopefully they are able to expand the park east where there had been an empty dirt lot for years. The food options are not healthy and the prices can be steep.
Pretty wide open. Get here earlier to save better free seats. Food not cheap but also not astronomical. Kids area wasn't too bad.

name: Fort Boise Park
address: 155 E Garrison Rd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: There's an awesome new bike park in the back behind the baseball fields. So many settings and courses for various ages and they also provide air, tools for repair, good bathrooms and water
The bike park is awesome.  This is creating a while generation of outdoor enthusiasts.
Love going here the options are endless with everything around for outdoor recreation.
Great family fun lots of pokestops if your family pays it's a nice place to get the family out walking :)
We were at the new bike park on the back side of the park.  If you love biking you got to check this out.

name: Spencer Air
address: 7239 Cascade Dr, Boise, ID 83704, USA
reviews: Spencer Air...The Most experienced Veteran pilots in Northwest United States! Scott Spencer is the originator of the best hot-air balloon events in NW. Scott has fun and adventure down to  perfection. Laurie, Scott’s bride, has flown alongside Scott nationwide touring with their major sponsors through the years. Scott creates gorgeous airships and designs delightful special shaped balloons that are state of the art quality and that are handled with care. Safety comes first- the aircrafts are all FAA certified and ready to fly. the crew that works for  Spencer Air have been precisely trained  and make your involvement in your special day flow beautiful and easy. In 42 years of my association with ballooning there has never been anything but a great memory to come from joining Spencer Air for the most exciting morning of your life!! Book your ride with the best!
The most rudest customer service ever! When I called them wondering how things work there, they were very rude and hung up on me. Never planning on going there ever.

You will not find any better adventure on this planet! Scott and Laurie are two of the nicest, knowledgeable, and funny people to be around. They took time to explain almost every aspect of how the balloon works, how they "drive" it, and what it takes to pilot one. I instantly felt I was a part of their ballooning family. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a fun adventure. A true world class experience.

name: Telaya Wine Co.
address: 240 E 32nd St, Garden City, ID 83714, USA
reviews: I'll be honest with you, I'm not a wine guy, but I love literally everything about this place. (1) Even for a guy who doesn't love wine, their stuff is outstanding. (2) The people who run it are OUTSTANDING. They're a couple of scientists who moved to Idaho after giving up really successful careers to do what they love and give their kids a childhood that included following your pipe dreams and working with your hands. What's not to love about that? (3) Arguably most importantly, having a drink on the back patio in the last lazy hours of a summer day, with the background babble of the river and chatter of people who know how good they have it at that moment, surrounded by good friends and drinking vino even a wine-sceptic can love, there is no better more comfortable environment in Boise. Hats off to the folks at Telaya.
Having been coming here about as long as Telaya has been open here it's absolutely the best place alone the greenbelt for wine and great conversation. The staff has always been the best.

What a wonderful place that made our day on a beautiful fall weekend walk.
The welcoming fire and heaters on the cozy yet spacious patio were an irresistible magnet drawing us in for an equally warm welcome by some of the nicest people ever. Loved the wines, hospitality, and the ambiance. A must stop and linger place for those seeking great wine and great service.

Great Wines and friendly people. This winery is so good. The location is amazing as well as their wines. Carrie and Earl, the winemakers, know what they are doing. This winery is located by a few other wineries so it makes a fun wine tasting day.

As if procured from the legendary Icelandic mjólkurvatn springs themselves, this was undoubtedly the best aquatic experience of my trip, and it's only my first day!  Smooth entry to a bold finish that tickled the sinuses, the Telaya wine was a treat, but the water was dessert. 12/10 would hydrate.

name: Manitou Park
address: 2001 S Manitou Ave, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews: It's a nice place to play with your dog on a very nice day and the hours of off leash apply.

The park is fully fenced for your dog to run around.   Problem is there is NO water except for what others brought in, and no pop bags or receptacles to put it in unless you go outside the gates area.  The rest of the park is nice where you can walk around it and there were people fishing in the pond.
The people are always well mannered with their dogs. The hours for off leash are a bit too wonky for the winter but overall one of our favorites!
Love this place! They always book a lot of entertainment here for both children and adults and more amazingly ITS FREE! This will always be one of my favorite recreational spots
it's not a off leash dog park...

name: Cinder Wines
address: 107 E 44th St, Garden City, ID 83714, USA
reviews:
Amazing wines, terrific customer care. Fun events and Food truck Friday’s where you can dine while enjoying the best wine around! 
Love this place!!
The staff is knowledgeable beyond something akin to a downtown Boise wine spot, has character and is one of the finest ambiances in Boise. Take a night to truly enjoy a hidden Garden City gem.

Delicious traditional wine. GREAT STAFF. A lil bit expensive on bottle prices. But overall a great place to visit. Don't forget to buy a growler on the way out the door so you can come back and drink some of their wines that are on tap. Unfortunately if you have a growler from another Winery they won't fill it because it's not one of theirs.

Took my friends to this winery and the staff were the BEST! Very hospitable and learned so much about wine from this place and they were nice enough to give us a tour of the place. Can’t wait to go back for another session of wine tasting here. The place looks great with chill vibes. We will be back soon! Thank you!

Very relaxing place to wine taste. Open area can fit quite a bit people inside while not feeling close to each other. Wines are also really good. Not a red wine fan but tried a few here and ended up tasting quite good. The sweet wine is also really good.

name: Sunset Park
address: 2625 N 32nd St, Boise, ID 83703, USA
reviews: The park is nice but the numbers and letters that are in a concrete circle needs fixed. One of my kids feel on a broken letter and got a bloody knee. Hopefully it will get fixed soon.
Has a decent field tennis courts ,basketball court , play ground, restrooms, and plenty of parking
Great place for the whole family. Get out and enjoy your day..
Great park with lots of mature shade trees, equipment for children, open spaces, tennis courts, and bathrooms, situated in a quiet neighborhood.
We love Sunset Park.  Great play areas for kids and TONS of room!!!

name: Phillippi Park
address: 2299 S Phillippi St, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews:
👍👍👍👍👍
This little gem of a park has paved walking loops for walking laps and a nice little play area that's appropriate for kids 6-12.

👍👍👍👍👍
It's clean and has a nice covered area with tables.
One of Boise's great neighborhood parks. Big with lots of open space.
Great park! Basketball, tennis, volleyball, big playground, covered picnic area. Lots of open grass. I love this park!
A really nice park and the greenbelt is beautiful

This is a great park for little and big kids. It is easy to keep an eye on your kids wherever they are playing. There is also a long path/loop that is perfect for a walk or kids to ride their bikes and scooters. Big sheltered area that's great for events. Best of all, this park is never packed, so it feels quiet and safe.

name: Catalpa Park
address: 4516 W Catalpa Dr, Boise, ID 83703, USA
reviews: Nice park to walk the pups.
One of my favorite parks in Boise.  Great playground for kids. Shade for parents. Tennis courts. Sand volleyball.  Open grassy area for whatever.

There is paved parking, a restroom, Horseshoe pits, a public art installation and a great big toy. The big toy was missing a connective tunnel between two pieces of the toy, it's blocked off by plywood and that makes the flow of play a tad awkward. There is a sweet stand alone firetruck and swings.
Nice neighborhood park.  Our daughter like to play on the equipment
Fun park great playground. Walking path, and tho havent tried guess you can fish the pond their.

name: Boise Art Museum
address: 670 Julia Davis Dr, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Very cute museum and a good way to pass the time. The art is more modern so if you're not into that kinda thing you might not like it. There seems to be a lot of activities for younger children.

Amazing workers and beautiful art. However, calling themselves "wheelchair accessible" feels like a massive joke. Their ramps are so steep my chair almost tipped over every single time I went up.They had a seperate ramp to reach each exhibit. It seemed silly, because 90% of the gallery was flat, or flat enough- minus one-three single small steps. There's no reason to block off accessibility. Such a small fix. There was a lot of ramps and a lot of "legally passing" wheelchair accessibility, but zero *real* accessibility. I'm amazing I didn't tip backwards and crack my head open. I truthfully hope this gets fixed.
Beautiful art. Not exactly my cup of tea but I still enjoyed my visit.

This museum is in an area that includes other attractions, the river, a park, and you can walk from here to some of the downtown restaurants and stores. But the museum itself is very nice. We had to pay less than $10 for two of us and it was a bargain. There was a temporary exhibit of contemporary art and galleries for several other art areas. Local artists as well as nationally known. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. This is not a large museum, but it is very efficient and easy to follow through to the various exhibits.
I especially enjoyed the high school art and the donut exhibit.

name: Morris Hill Park
address: 10 N Roosevelt St, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews: It was nice that the park manager brings in a lot of water and stores it in a small cooler for the dogs in the off season. The park during the winter is a bit messy but the big dogs love it. A covered patio is nice to sit under for cover from the elements. A separate area for the small dogs is useful so they don't get trampled by the big dogs.
close to home and not crowded. Always lots of tennis balls for your dog to fetch.Bring your own water, until the dog watering fountain is turned on in mid April
Lots of great dog owners here and lots of friendly pooches my dog loves this park
Great place for the kiddos. The age group is 2 to 5 years.

Beautiful park! My dog loves to play at the dog park too! They have separate areas for big dogs and little dogs, as well as agility props and fun things to sniff. People have left old tennis balls for the dogs to play with. The only thing I would like to see changed is to have the drinking fountain in the dog park repaired.

name: Heroes Park
address: 3064 W Malta Dr, Meridian, ID 83646, USA
reviews: Nice park with lots of parking and covered patio.   Lacrosse tournament held there & plenty of grass area.   Dog friendly & close to stores!
Best park in Caldwell! Love watching our daughter play soccer there!

Velvet grass soccer fields. Very well maintained relative to the intense abuse it takes. Decent play structures and clean restrooms. Has one large covered picnic area. Smooth running/walking trail around the perimeter.
Great park! A nice playground for kids, basketball court, and a track if you are looking to get some cadtio in. Plenty of space if you are looking to take the family out for a birthday or picnic.
Nice park with large grassy areas, two separate playgrounds structures, swings, a ramada, and plenty of benches.

name: James Castle House
address: 5015 Eugene St, Boise, ID 83703, USA
reviews: They had an amazing virtual reality experience there, great curators that explain the history and art, great art.

This house of American artist James Castle is such an amazing gem for Boise! With its ongoing art and artifact exhibitions, a boutique gift shop, and artists living on site, it’s such a unique way to learn about Castle and his artwork. Don’t miss the historic shed where Castle lives and worked for many years!
Fantastic! What a wonderful display of James Castle's art and experience.
Such  a unique story.  Such a unique life

I have visited the house several times and each time is memorable, delightful and fresh. All of the merchandise is impeccably selected. All of the staff is genuine and enthusiastic. My daughter has taken an art class here and enjoyed it very much. I bring all of my friends from out of town. Visit. Over and over. It's always a new experience.

name: Redwood Park
address: 2675 N Shamrock Ave, Boise, ID 83713, USA
reviews: It was great! We went during open leash time, lots of very well-behaved pups and their humans who were all very welcoming. Lots of open space for the dogs to fetch or just run, playground set for the kiddos, and a small pond that the geese and ducks like to relax in.

This is a wonderful public park right in the heart of West Valley. There's a nice paved loop that follows the perimeter of the park, as well as a children's playground. There's this big duck pond in the back corner where there are as many as 50-100 ducks and geese. There's usually enough parking and there's a portapotty in case nature calls while you're in nature. Really nice park, I definitely recommend stopping by here if you're in the area.

The park is nice and open and the pond allows for some up close interaction with the local ducks and geese. The only downfall is that we visited the location with hopes to feed some of the animals but found a no feeding policy in place. With respects to this policy we did some walking around the park and spent some time watching the ducks and geese.
Nice playground, big grass area, pond with ducks, family oriented and good for dogs too
Excellent dog park. Everyone is really nice. Lots of space. Very fun for the dogs.

name: Tully Park
address: 2500 N Linder Rd, Meridian, ID 83646, USA
reviews: Skateboarding, shelters, exercising stations, playground, basketball court, restrooms and open play areas. Great family park. If you like pokemon, it has gyms and stops. Bud Porter pathway runs along the side of the park.

Tully Park is an excellently organized family play place. The parking lot is adequate for even the busiest multi-sport Saturday. At one side is a large covered area with tables, a well designed children's play area, an exercise warm up area and clean restrooms all of which are ADA accessible. Nearby are a basketball court, a well designed multilevel  skateboard area and sufficient playing fields to support simultaneous baseball, football, soccer and lacrosse games. A great place for the entire family.
Great park, very clean and nice. The work out equipment is awesome for busy mom's to utilize while kids play, and many more special things A MUST SEE to enjoy!!
this park is amazing.  go here. do it. lots to explore. great for kids and the elderly. take time out of your day. do it. go to the park.
Nice quiet park with a lot of stuff to do. People are friendly and greet with the smile

name: Dona Larsen Park
address: 150 South Broadway, Boise, ID 83712, USA
reviews: A very nice facility, but I have one complaint. I wasn't allowed to take in my soda so I drank it first and then entered. I wasn't allowed to take the empty bottle in so I asked if there was a recycling. I was told there wasn't and I could just throw it away. So, I asked if I could keep the empty bottle to take home and recycle. Again, I was told no, to just throw it away. I thought Boise's recycling program makes it fairly easy to recycle. Come on Dona Larsen I'm trying to do my part to take care of our Earth. Why aren't you?
Should figure out parking for a University track facility.
Very nice stadium once you conquer the lack of parking.
Nice facility. Could use a LOT more parking.

Super grateful for this stadium for our kids.....plan for a walk from the parking lot. Or pay $5 to park close at the local businesses. But DON'T park in the facility's lot during a HS football game...they will tow you away! :D

name: Warhawk Air Museum
address: 201 Municipal Dr, Nampa, ID 83687, USA
reviews: I came and spent a couple hours here. Lots of information and several beautiful airplanes and a few classic cars.  I really enjoyed talking with Jack which was one of their volunteers. I look forward to coming back!

The history in this museum  is astounding.  You could spend a day here and still not see everything.   A great place for kids as they have a scavenger hunt.  Everyone  could learn a little something  (or a lot) from this museum.
What an amazing place!  Honoring our veterans who have fought for our freedom, they have done an amazing job!  The staff are informative, helpful, friendly.  You won't be disappointed!

Best museum in Nampa, canyon county and maybe the entire treasure valley.  Take your kids, your siblings, your parents or grandparents.  You will get a great education in military aviation and other aspects of the armed services of the United States of America.  They have great special events. They have an army of volunteers, many who are Vets and are willing to make your visit special.
Great Air Museum! Different! A lot of GREAT history you don't generally see elsewhere. Give yourself PLENTY OF TIME there. It's a real education.

name: Fuller Park
address: 3761 W Park Creek Dr, Meridian, ID 83642, USA
reviews: We reserved shelter 3 for my son's graduation picnic. Fuller Park is a hidden gem that isn't very well known. The mature trees off we plenty of shade, and the park is well maintained. The shelter had large picnic tables, a BBQ grill and electrical outlets. Our party of 20 had ample space to spread out and serve food. The sand volleyball pit next to the shelter was used by another group and they appeared to be having a great time! This is one of the best parks in Meridian.
Amazing lil'park with a really nice pond! Good place to get some walking in for the day:)

This a place where you can really get a taste of Idaho living. Upgraded playground equipment, spacious grassy areas, picnic shelters, trees that make your kids think of redwoods, a few baseball fields, volleyball, and a pond to fish in !

Clean restrooms and shaded pavilion right next to four amazing play structures! Every mom's dream. One of the structures is even two stories. It wasn't too busy on a weekday and it's away from major roads.

So many fun things to do here! Walking path, duck pond (don't feed the ducks), exercise area, volleyball pit, baseball fields, and a big playground with all age levels included. Plenty of parking, bathrooms, and a snow cone shack in the summer.

name: Renaissance Park
address: 4155 S Genoard Ave, Meridian, ID 83642, USA
reviews: This is in the Tuscany subdivision, where I live.  Nice place to walk and use the playground equipment.
Good place for kids. Permanent restrooms and water fountain. Nice place to have practice.
A great hidden gem in meridian! Not the biggest park, but has a covered patio area, a basketball court, and playground equipment. Plus enough grass to run around and play in and host events.
Nice place for kids, families. So many things to do. Always clean and feels safe!
