It has swings, kids play equipment, bathrooms, a covered picnic area and large grassy area. Can get busy in the fall evenings with soccer and flag football practoce

name: Barbacoa Grill
address: 276 West Bobwhite Ct, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews:
Amazing fine dining. Dined on an evening weeknight and the place was packed. I Avoided the wait for a table by dining at the bar.
  Served NY Strip rare on hot granite block. The longer you keep it in the block the more cooked it becomes to your desired like. Brilliant.
Great food and atmosphere along with friendly and efficient employees made for a pleasing dining experience.

One of the best meals I've had out in Boise.  Service is very good and quick.  The food is fantastic.  Had the Hot Rock Fillet and it was the best steak I've ever had.  I highly recommend this place.  Added bonus: 2 for 1 drinks during happy hour which is 4-6.

This has to be one of the best happy hours in town (Buy One Get One mixed drink menu). While the atmosphere is a little loud, the drinks are expertly crafted. I have sunken into the rut (I never intend to leave) of Old Fashions. They use quality ingredients and (I believe) a rye whiskey. This is the secret to good Old Fashions for the discerning: rye whiskey. Pair off this with guacamole and you have yourself a date!

One of my favorite local restaurants. Truly one of the gems of Boise Idaho. Incredible atmosphere. Wild and unique art. Top notch food. My personal favorite is the hot rock fillet. The cognac cream sauce is just to die for. They have a great private dining space for large groups or business gatherings. Highly recommend. ( Side note: They do a buffet for Thanksgiving dinner that is out of this world.)
What a unique experience. I don't think I've ever seen a place with more unique decor. Very eclectic. And really terrific food as well. Very original presentations. And you have to try the guacamole

name: Fork
address: 199 N 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: The food was delicious!  Our server was polite and was very efficient.  We had so much fun.  Each of our dishes came out exactly how we wanted.  I highly recommend the Glazed Brussel Sprouts and the Asparagus Fries.

Excellent food and nice atmosphere. Staff was friendly and took great care of us. Had the tacos for an appetizer and they were amazing! Had a Cuban sandwich as my boyfriend got a burger, both very good. Had to save room for dessert and got the bread pudding and it was one of the best desserts I’ve ever had! Warm bread pudding with ice cream... delicious!

Went downtown for coffee and dessert.  The coffee was the best!!!
We had the huckleberry ice cream and the caramel swirl ice cream. The 3rd dessert was enough for 3: a large brownie, 2 or 3 scoops of vanilla ice cream, topped with whipped cream.  The restaurant is in an old building that has been elegantly renovated. The restaurant was busy on Saturday night, but we were seated promptly.  Would definitely return when visiting Boise, ID again!

Absolutely great place. Love each dish. The flavors are real good. This is the best in Boise, Idaho area. We loved how family friendly it was. We have children and they gave coloring pages as well as activity sticks to mend. Our favorite is wine braised beef with mashed potatoes- the best dish and incredible flavor. Awesome place to celebrate a life event. Thank you Fork!

Dining experiences like this are few and far between. We had tempered our expectations due to a local barista telling us that Fork "wasn't as good as it claims to be". You walk in to wood and brick tones coupled with decor that immediately gives you the impression that you'll be paying $40 per person, then you open the menu and are pleasantly surprised to find very reasonable prices with the most costly brunch plate being just under $14. I had the Chef's Benny, an amazing take on Eggs Benedict. The poached eggs were perfect spheres and the yolk spilled out in perfect creamy splendor. My best friend gave me a piece of his bacon and I immediately ordered a side of it. Candied cayenne bacon is now the only way I'm going to make bacon. Then there was our server, Erica. Aside from having an amazing smile, she was friendly and just the right amount of attentive to not be overbearing but make sure we weren't neglected. Overall, this five-star experience actually makes me disappointed that I don't live in Boise so I can come back and try everything else on the menu over time. Thank you Erica and Fork for the phenomenal brunch!

name: ALAVITA
address: 807 W Idaho St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: This place is literally the best place in Boise. The combinations of flavors and quality of food amazes me Everytime. I usually get the entrees rather than the pasta here and I have been impressed each time. My significant other usually gets the pasta and he has given just as much praise. The service here is also so caring and welcoming, it makes me just want to hang out there longer. The drinks are quite delicious too. If your a foodie and love great service, defiantly go here. They show a lot of creativity, care, and quality in their food, service, and atmosphere.

The mussels were outstanding. The gluten free pasta in my seafood dish was not cooked well; however it was loaded with seafood, which made up for it. Nice atmosphere and good service. I would go back.

Consistently great service and food. There are plenty of gluten free options if needed. The portions are normal sized. Wonderful flavors; you want to savor these bites! The decor and ambiance are also unique and attractive. Nice that you can see the whole team of employees working together well.

Fantastic service and excellent food plus a suave, romantic ambiance. Entire staff was very friendly and attentive, clearing plates and filling water quickly, checking to make sure we didn't need anything else.  Food was outstanding, from the winter citrus & arancini appetizers to the fresh-made pasta.  Cocktails also excellent, especially the smoked cocktail that comes in an inverted glass filled with smoke from a scorched piece of wood.

Tonight was an amazing first experience at ALAVITA with my hubby!! The staff was very professional, informative about their menu, and super friendly!! You can taste the passion that goes into their food and the flavors just sing in your mouth!! We will definitely be coming back for sure!!

name: Chandlers
address: 981 W Grove St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: The Rona has done nothing to impact the quality of food or service from Chandlers!  Attention to detail is still a priority!!  High quality containers, bread & all the butters, bags packed so the dinners arrive intact & beautifully presented!  PLUS, timing is perfect!   Cold food was still cold, hot food was still hot.  Of course, every morsel was delicious!  Congratulation to everyone for you ability to overcome obstacles & delivery what everyone expects!  The best dining experience in Boise!

What's great here? The music and the service. The food is a bit hit or miss, which can be disappointing as prices are high. Wine list is impressive but hard to actually use. Cocktails are good. List of wines by the glass is only okay. 

I like to support live music. I appreciate that they have live bands here.

Fabulous...everything was perfect! From the host to everyone we encountered. Food was made to perfection and the drinks were the best I've ordered from a restaurant. 
Absolutely recommended

It's beautiful and the music enjoyable. The service was outstanding and the Wagyu/Angus steak was the best steak I've had in my entire life, worth the money, cooked perfectly. Our servers were Wesley and Clayton and they were on top of all our needs all evening, informative, kind, cheerful, and professional. Our server in the lounge before dinner was a lovely young lady with a lot of energy and interest and when they were out of the wine I chose, she returned with an informative second choice suggestion for me. Everything about Chandler's is classy and high quality and delivers an unforgettable experience. Thank you, Chandler's for making our little celebration special!

I don't think a review on this place is necessary but I'll do it anyway. We sat at the bar early ,place packs fast do make reservations or be there at 4. Service was impecable and food was great. Typical great American steak house. No fancy stuff. Great steaks, great crab, great wine and scotch , great service. A must

name: Bardenay Restaurant & Distillery - Boise
address: 610 W Grove St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Local distillery featuring house gin, vodka, and rum - special lemon vodka and ginger rum. (And featuring their own whisky soon!) A menu with bartenders craft cocktails changes monthly. We just ordered the Sage Advice and it’s amazing - well balanced and smooth. There’s 24 bottles of wine on tap. The menu has exceptional variety and we’ll return for dinner the next time we’re here.

Great atmosphere to get drinks after work, weekends, etc. Food is excellent, fresh ingredients and cooked to perfection. Cheese board appetizer is the best! The pairings are spot on and intrigue your mouth. Not very accommodating for business lunch (tables are tiny).  Friendly and knowledgeable staff, Brei was so nice!

Attentive friendly staff. I love their Bruschetta. Their kids meals are full meals. But it's more of a bar setting so having kiddos there feels a little awkward. Other than that it food was tasty and drinks are good.

Bardenay is one of our favorite downtown dining experiences. We like coming down for a drink and food when we can. Happy hour is great, just make sure to get here before 6PM. They have great vegan/vegetarian options. I highly recommend the sweet potato chimichanga. Parking can be tricky at times, it might be best to park in the parking garage above the Egyptian Theater.
My favorite place to go. Thai Fighter and good bacon wrapped filet or grilled shrimp salad. Amazing staff!!!

name: Bittercreek Alehouse
address: 246 N 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: The quality of the food here is amazing! I’ve never had a sub par meal here. It is a  packed house most of the time and there is a really good reason for that.

Great place for a quick bite or a full meal. Tons of beer choices. Bottles or on tap. Great wings. The salads were fresh and full of ingredients.  The chips and queso were a nice surprise as well. The mac and cheese appetizer was a good sized portion and very cheesy and hot, my son loved it.

The beer is good and the server was friendly. The pretzel is the best I've ever had. However, we waited over 40 minutes for the main courses and didn't see our server again for 20 minutes after he dropped the food. He didn't even check back with us to see how everything came out. Overall, food was great but not sure it was worth the wait.
Good food. Great location. Nothing better than sitting on 8th street and eating a high quality burger with a cold beverage. Atmosphere of the restaurant is amazing too
This place smelled delicious as we walked in for dinner. Super friendly service! We had Randezvous Red wine, poutine, salad and a burger. Delicious meal!!!!

name: Luciano's Italian Restaurant
address: 11 N Orchard St, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews: We have eaten here several times and the food is always wonderful.   Our server was friendly and made excellent suggestions.   I had the special which was amazing.   Shrimp, chicken and sausage in a spicy cream sauce over four cheese ravioli,  I would recommend it but be aware it is a bit spicy.   We were with a fairly large group and everyone had a fantastic time.  Though it is not cheap it is worth it!!!

Finally had the chance to go here for my birthday back in February. This place lives up to their reputation! Food was phenomenal,  service was 5 star! Wish I could remember my servers name bc she was great. Hope to come back soon and try some other dishes!

Luciano's in easily one of the best Italian restaurants in Boise. Everything I have had here is good and the service is excellent. The only thing that drives me crazy is the wait time to get your food. These guys are slow! But their food is really good and the price is decent as well. They also have really good bread for you to snack on during the eternity it takes to get your food.

This place is very very friendly for couples having a romantic atmosphere and being very very friendly for couples over 21. They have a wine bar in the waiting area, so while the wait may be long you can still enjoy yourself during the wait.  The chef specials are always delicious, which isn't a surprise as I've never been disappointed with any meals I've ever had here. There are some items on the menu that may be 1.5-2x as expensive as another Italian restaurant but with the food being 3x as good it is well WELL worth it. If you've never been somewhere like this before no worries the staff will be able to give you a laundry list of fantastic recommendations.  There is not one item on the menu that will disappoint and that is something yo uh can bet on. Given the price point the and the atmosphere I would not so much recommend this as a place to take children but not many places in the area can compete as a venue to celebrate an anniversary or other momentous occasion.  It's not a big chain, which for fine dining is very important as it ensures quality is consistent every single time you visit.

Call ahead, or make reservations. We ended up waiting an hour to be seated, but it was worth it! The atmosphere is cozy and charming. It's a popular place, but on the smaller side, so there is usually a wait if you walk in. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  Our waitress was Cassandra, and she was amazing. Our glasses were always full, she was friendly and accommodating, and she was a rather good salesperson. I usually don't get appetizers or dessert, but she convinced us to get both. The food was delicious and even though it was packed, they brought the food out in a timely manner. I can understand why they have many awards for Boise's best Italian. Picture perfect dining experience. We're definitely going back!

name: Eureka!
address: 800 W Idaho St Suite 120, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Eureka! is one of the more consistent spots for service and food on 8th street in downtown Boise! They have a very creative seasonal drink menu and the food is seriously legit! They have a wide variety of menu items and everything that I have tried has been delicious. I totally recommend these guys, especially for happy hour!
Generally pretty busy in the evening. Like all other restaurants in the area, parking is a task of it's own. Loved the burger and drinks selection.

Friendly and fast service.  The food was fantastic and they had lots of options.  I was very impressed by their beer menu, with an awesome selection of beers from some of the best craft brewers all over the country.  Will definitely be coming back the next time I am in town.  Prices were reasonable as well.

First time at Eureka. Excellent service by Kate. I tried the Lollipop Corndogs, and the Truffle Cheese Fries - both were well-prepared and tasted delicious. My wife thought the Hemp Bowl was absolutely wonderful - both because of the great taste and the emotional joy from eating healthy. Definitely try this place out.

Eureka is one of my favorite places to go downtown. The appetizers are really unique and I haven't had one that I didn't like yet. The deviled eggs with horseradish are to die for and the firecracker sauce on the hot wings is out of this world. When you bring children they bring their food out first to make sure they aren't waiting too long. I have had a little trouble when ordering drinks that they seem to sit at the bar and the waitstaff forgets to bring it to your table for a long time so it just sits there - on more than one occasion,  however their drinks are to die for and are ALWAYS worth the wait. I have tried about half of the items on the menu and all of the appetizers and have only had one thing I didn't care for. The hemp bowl is my favorite entree, and my husband loves the jalapeno egg burger. It is worth going to try their food just because of all the different options they have that are exciting and so different than other restaurants.  Eureka is really something special.

name: The Basque Market
address: 608 W Grove St #5926, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews:
Very Satisfying experience from the minute I walked in, to the last moment trying to force the final morsel down my throat.  Very attentive and knowledgeable server!  Not knowing the culture or the type of foods to order, the waiter was a plus as he knew exactly what we should order and what we would find enjoyable. The experience was great.  

Appetizers we had the Olive dip, the cheese dip and then this really good bacon sweet paradise dip that they made especially for that day, I think it contained goat cheese. Oh my goodness with the baguette it was wonderful.  For the main course. Braised pork loin you can see the picture it was topped with a great balsamic vinegar and it was delicious.  Bread was freshly baked.

You are missing out if you do not pop in here. I highly recommend this place.  Price is super reasonable

The Basque Market is a great place to learn about the rich Basque culture of this area. We tried some Basque cuisine; the cheese croquettes were great! Back in 2009, The Basque Market held a function for our convention where they use a gigantic paella pan and cooked for hundreds of people! Apparently they do this at least once a week during the warmer seasons. This last time I was at the market I bought a Basque cookbook. I can't wait to try some recipes.

Great place. Must visit. The meatballs were out of this world. Get two serves, trust me. The paella pockets were not great - a bit oily and claggy, but still tasty. The wine selection is very f good with a lot of interesting Basque and Spanish wines.

Highly recommend this place. Coming to the basque market before flying out Boise, thus, we didn’t know what to expect. Walked passed by this place to take a gamble and glad we did it as the food is delicious, and very reasonably priced too!

This is a must stop on any visit to Boise. I usually come for the fresh made paella, currently served Wednesday and Friday at noon. You can watch it be prepared right outside the market. I would recommend coming at least a half hour in advance. Try their wine slushy sangria, topped with red wine, beware of brain freeze. If you come the last weekend in July there is a Basque festival. Live music, food and drinks. The market is small inside but there is seating outside.

name: Goodwood Barbecue Company
address: 7849 W Spectrum St, Boise, ID 83709, USA
reviews: I have never been to this place, but wow is it just the best place to eat. It has a nice semi romantic atmosphere and the service is fast and very respectful. The food was well worth the price and the proportion size beats any other place to date for the value. I would recommend it to anyone

I usually order the Prime Rib, but they were out, so this steak had to fit the bill.  It was cooked to perfection (medium), and the loaded baked potato was absolutely wonderful.  I prefer Goodwood to Texas Roadhouse.  One of the best if not the best steaks in Boise!

I always mean to try something new, but after I tried the brisket salad, I've never changed to something else. Absolutely delicious!  They used to have a small or large portion, now it's just one size and seems to be just about right. Great service!

Beef ribs and loaded mashed potatoes!! The food is always excellent and the prices aren't too high. It isn't a cheap place to eat but it is worth the money. They have some pretty great chicken fried steak too.

Service was excellent and food was delicious. Restaurant was clean and the aromas of barbecue were intoxicating. The food was hot which is a big deal for me since alot of place serve lukewarm dishes. Our server was Jake and he took good care of us. Refilled our drinks before we even had to ask and brought our food out in a good amount of time. We will definitely visit again when here in Idaho.

name: CasaBlanca Cuban Grill
address: 5506 W Overland Rd, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews: Awesome authentic Cuban food! I love this place, great for birthdays or for groups. We go there as often as we can. I can't always understand what I am ordering (Spanish dishes) and yet I have never been disappointed.

I really wanted to like this place.  The Chirizo Croquettes were a pleasant start, but the pork dish was dry, even with the sautéed onions to help out.
Service was friendly, and maybe I just picked an off day.

If you've driven past this place for years, curious but never stopping by like I did, stop! The meat was hot and tender and flavorful, the atmosphere was cozy, and the service friendly. I was really pleasantly surprised when I tried some new tastes I've never tried before, like the black bean soup and coconut flan. Very yummy!
We stopped at the restaurant after leaving the Boise Airport. The staff was friendly and efficient.  We enjoyed our lunches as they were tasty and reminded us of our trip to Cuba.
Casa Blanca is my favorite restaurant! My friends and I go their about once a month. The severs remember us! The food and the atmosphere are fantastic!

name: Willowcreek Grill
address: 2273 S Vista Ave #150, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews: If I could give them more stars I totally would!! Willowcreek is awesome! Their regular menu is tasty and feels home cooked! Their sushi is the best in town! I have never ever had bad service here! Such wonderful people and awesome food! I highly recommend!

Ample parking. Really good burger. Good service. Surprisingly fresh playlist of 80s pop and dance hits. Based on what I tasted,  I wouldn't come here for the sushi. But the waitress made me a really good grenadine and coke. Altogether 3 thumbs up.

My girl likes sushi and I don't so much. Found this place on google and loved it! Great non sea food options and my girlfriend loved the sushi. They have an awards card too. Friendly staff and and environment. Great music playing at an appropriate volume as well. Excellent place for when some in your party want sushi and others might not.
Great lunch option in Boise. You can offer American fare, or try something off the Raw sushi menu. Business-casual atmosphere.

Received a lovely letter from the manager after a negative experience we had at Willowcreek Grill, and I was very impressed.  It was obvious that she listened to and responded to my concerns and was going to address them with her staff.  I am very understanding of the fact that our experience was probably not the typical.  Thank you to management for taking the extra and personal time to address my concerns.  We will certainly be back.

name: Capitol Cellars
address: 110 S 5th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Here is a hidden gem in Boise. A political themed menu in the basement of a downtown building. Great staff and excellent food.  I was quite pleased with my entire dining experience.  I will go back and looking forward to bringing friends for a lively debate over some delicious Idaho based food

The food is mediocre. $24 for a sea bass, some bland rice and 8 green beans. My waitress was ok. I order a soup and salad for me, I said I will have a soup and salad, and she took off and didn't take my wife's appetizer order. When she came back I had to say that was just for me, my wife needs to order. She left and brought out our salad and didn't ask what we had wanted to order for our main course. When she brought our soup that's when I said can we order our main course.  The soup, French onion, was very watered down. I've had some very nice French onion soup and this was not very good at all. We won't be going back
The food was really good! We sampled food from all areas of the menu and it was all delicious! Service was very helpful and friendly. Great birthday dinner! We'll be back 😊

Valentine's Day/Retirement special occasion dinner....Sat down right @ 5:00 reservation time. Seeing later tables being served, had to ask for a server @ 5:15 to get cocktails which were good. Got red balloon glasses for a chard. Server poured away, no tasting that $100 bottle. I ordered lamb chops, got the pork. Food presentation poor and food very salty. Second bad experience here, we're out.
Such a nice place! Very delicious food, good service. Good for fancy romantic dates, has that nice atmosphere. 😊

name: Tucanos Brazilian Grill
address: 1388 S Entertainment Ave, Boise, ID 83709, USA
reviews: If you’ve never experienced Tucanos before, it’s time. I’ve been to eat at a Tucanos dozens of times and I don’t even live within 3 hours of one. The food is great. The service is great. Atmosphere is fun. It’s all you can eat for a flat price. It’s worth the trip.

We were brought here by a company we do business with and I have to say the entire experience was amazing. Start off w the salad bar and let the servers bring you all sorts of meats. Simply delicious. Great service. Recipe for success.

By far the better option between the different Brazilian grills in the Treasure Valley. Excellent variety on the salad bar including soups, pasta, and salads all of it very fresh! As for the meat selection, it is solid in variety and excellent in flavor! They do not have any lamb options which some may be disappointed to hear. Only reason for a star being knocked off is the last few times I've been in I've noticed that the size of the meat, fish, and vegatable served to me by each server is quite small which would be fine but the frequency at which the servers come by your table has also dropped...not enough that I won't be going back, yet.

Angela was helpful on our first time there. She was very cautious and sweet and checking on us regularly. I super loved the energy from Levi the meat guy he was sweet and bubbly and looked as though he enjoyed his job. The manger of the store came by and checked on us. Super happy place.  Fully recommend also all there food was made fresh.  There variety of things to eat were incredible seriously all type of things

It had been about 2 years since my wife and I had been to Tucanos. We decided to go on New Years Eve. When we checked in at the  front counter for our reservation, they informed me that the dinner pruce was $31.95 that night, not the regular $24.95. We were seated right away. And throughout the meal the service was very good. 

The food was less than average though. Salad bar was nothing special at all - but the Lobster Bisque was pretty good. The wide variety of meat delivered on skewers was for the most part dry and kinda tasteless, some samples tough and chewy.  The meal that night did come with a piece of cheesecake which was OK. And, a nice touch, there were party favors on the tables to help celebrate the New Year. 

This was not the way I remember the food. I loved the food before, not now.

name: Cucina Di Paolo
address: 1504 S Vista Ave, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews: Republic Services bought all the front line employees a lasagna from here. I would have never found this place if not for that and oh, man was I missing out. Fresh ingredients, amazing sauces. Easy at home heating instructions. Pick one up and take it home! They have a new customer for life!

LOVE the food and service! Saw their story online and the reviews raving about their delicious creations. That brought our family when visiting Boise for a short period of time. 

Definitely give their pasta dishes, sandwiches, salads, and homemade desserts a try! Such a homey feeling and the hospitality was wonderful.

Fun Italian place to try with friends. I had not been to a similar place before. Very friendly service and good food. Very limited seating but good selection of food. We will definitely try their made to order take out lasagna sometime in the future. You don't want to miss trying this one!

Loved the beef ravioli and the New England clam chowder. Great little restaurant, most welcoming with excellent, personalized service. They have lasagna...and so much more. It'll take many more visits to try everything, and we will.

From the outside you won't be convinced this is the place.  When you walk in,  you're still wondering why your friend has brought you here.   After your first bites, you realize why this is on the go- to places for those looking for good foods in Boise.  Consistently good, crafted with character, and always much better than processed box store food! Soups with fabulous flavor, hearty pasta, perfect salads and sandwiches.  Thank you cucina di Paolo for being that place!

name: Txikiteo
address: 175 N 14th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: This place is awesome! The staff are really friendly and helpful. The food is amazing. Bold flavors and unique styles. Highly recommend for date nights or group gatherings.

A place that is open sort of late at the edge of downtown.  Good service and a relaxed vibe. The mixed board was very well priced and you get a lot to try and the other tapas are very reasonably priced. Didn't do drinks this time but it looked interesting.  Free wifi and nice outdoor area. Great addition to the Boise food scene.
Very quaint, but so friendly! The staff did an excellent job of helping decide on wines to start off the meal. Food was well prepared and taste profiles were spot on. Would definitely visit again.

we arrived to Txikiteo late one evening, and were shown AMAZING hospitality. it was so cold outside and there were no open tables inside. One of the waiters there was able to turn on some heaters and gave us blankets while he rearranged some tables inside for us so we could squeeze in. we were outside no more than 5 min, and were seated quickly, where it was warm! Great hospitality and even better drinks and food. totally recommend this spot!

Very hip and inviting environment with counter service. Food was great with several different appetizers and dishes to choose from. Wine and coffee from around the world. Service was great with friendly knowledgeable staff. Well behaved kid friendly environment with a downtown location. Prices very reasonable. I will return anytime I'm in Boise.

name: Red Feather Lounge
address: 246 N 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Enjoyed a great brunch today! First time at Red Feather and glad I finally made a point to try it. Service was friendly and fast and the restaurant has a cozy vibe even though it is two stories and quite roomy. I had eggs Benedict and a waffle both of which were tasty. Lots of great and yummy choices on the menu. My husband had one of the skillet scrambles and our friend had chicken and biscuits which also tasted great.

Delicious food and great craft cocktails. Must make a reservation on weekends for sure or you won’t get a table. Some portion sizes can be a bit small, so order a few things and share. Love this place and will be back!

BEST drinks in Boise. Go sit at the bar, order some drinks, people watch, talk to the bartenders, watch the weird things on the TV, order some food. This place has the best vibe in Boise. Upscale, but not arrogant. The bartenders make a fabulous drink selection of things you've never tried before--which seem  to be changed out seasonally. Each one is perfect, and beautiful, in it's own way. If you want something more intimate, head upstairs. If you're planning on dinner, make a reservation! (Don't forget to try the fries...Seriously! And stay for the dessert.) Plan to pay for the quality, it's worth it. (Shout out to Daniel and Chris--so nice, and made us feel like we belonged.)
Always a lovely experience. I feel classy and special thanks to the waiters and cooks. The quality of food is phenomenal, and I'm always excited to try their new items

Came for brunch, and our reservation was ready on time. I think we either hit an off or busy morning though, because even though we got seated, we weren't served right away, and several times found ourselves waiting for someone to come back and check up and/or take our order.  The food was amazing though, and I highly recommend the cheddar potato side (far superior to the crispy). There were also an impressive number of options for our vegetarian members. However, we ordered bingets, and then didn't get them until after the meal, when we reminded the waiter. But, they were on the house as an apology. Would definitely come back!

name: Boise Fry Company
address: 204 N Capitol Blvd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: We enjoyed the Boise Fry Co. We ordered the Bison burger with the purple fries.  The food was very tasty and the fries were very good. I've never had purple fries and found them  to be really good. The crowd was kind of trendy when were in. It feels like the  type of place students would congregate to grab a bite and discuss assignments. It was quite expensive for what we are. Three burgers, fries, and a drink for three was $55 for three with a tip. We would visit again.

*100+ years from now on a planet far far away*
Human in the future 1: "Is there anything we know about the city Boise from planet earth?"
Human in the future 2: "yes, Boise fry company and their delicious fries are what we have saved in our records".

Okay...maybe not. But this is how I imagine it. 

I wish I lived in Boise, ID just so I could go here whenever I'm craving burgers and fries. Don't get me wrong, the menu extends beyond that, but the assortment of potato types (gold, russet, red, purple, etc) and cuts (home style, waffle, thin) make fries the bread and butter of this establishment. 

Did I mention the variety of dipping sauces? Do I need to? So good! I tried the blueberry aioli with purple fries and was blown away. The trays are designed to comfortably set three sauces onto them, something I appreciated. 

I was also a fan of the fountain drink selection. The machines had local lemonade and "healthier" soda options.

The overall experience was great, the staff was friendly and helpful when we ordered. We order the red potatoes and beef classic hamburger. The French fries were definitely the highlight of the meal, they have different sauce and salt station that you can try.  The hamburger was below par.

Lots of selection for fries, and they are all delicious too. Lots of sauce choices as well.   Food is fresh.  The burgers were good but not the best I have had, however the restaurant is definitely worth trying!
Really good burgers and even better fries. The staff is friendly and the wait time isn't too long. Would highly recommend.

name: Big Jud's
address: 1289 S Protest Rd, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews: Great burger. I knew I couldn't handle the monster burgers, so I ordered a "simple" double. It was enormous... and delicious. I can recommend the Scotch and Soda too (think vanilla Sprite). Our table also enjoyed the fish and chips, and the sweet potato waffle fries. Well done, big Jud!

Great nostalgic burger joint. The French fries a very different, giant Idaho potato fries with soft potato centers. Burgers are delicious and made fresh. Dessert ice cream is very good! Nice table service, staff are friendly. Restaurant is very clean and well kept. Price is reasonable. We will definitely be visiting again.

A Boise classic. Quality, mostly locally-sourced diner fare with very upbeat, friendly staff. Home of the famous 1lb cheeseburger (up to 4 lb if you think you can handle it). Both quality AND quantity.

My first time here and I will definitely be a repeat customer.  I had a bacon cheeseburger and it was wonderful. I ordered a to-go meal and it took more than twice as long than what they quoted me to get my food to me. That is the only reason I gave four stars instead of five

Ate here yesterday (9-7-19) and got the $38 burger and fries/tots... super yummy and the service was excellent.  The burger fed 3 people and half went home for leftovers.... restaurant was clean and waitress super nice. Will definitely eat here again If in the area

name: Riverside Grill
address: 2900 W Chinden Blvd, Boise, ID 83714, USA
reviews: Service was not very attentive to our table. You have to ask for water to be filled. Food was good and the ambiance was also good. I'll come back.
Nice staff, good music on a Tuesday.  He greeted everyone on his break.  Class act.

31st person to review Riverside Grill, Boise, Idaho, located inside the Riverside Hotel. Open to the public, not just hotel guests. 
This is my 380th review on Yelp. 

I've eaten here twice now. I come here often for work when representing my company on Job Fairs through the Idaho Business League. 

Both times I've eaten here, the food has been ample, very well presented, great quality, and most importantly a great taste. 

I had a salad on my first visit and my most recent I got the spaghetti squash spaghetti which was super yummy and very affordable ($7), completely vegan (I'm not). The noodles were perfectly cooked and somewhat fries which gave it the best tasting crunch.

We stopped in for a drink in the lounge at the Riverside Grill before going to the sandbar for dinner. It was a quiet relaxing place to talk and enjoy a drink while waiting for our table and I was grateful for the space. I also enjoyed the live music that was in the background but not too loud.
Nicole was our server and she was awesome! We came for Sunday brunch and had bottomless mimosas. The music was fantastic. Highly recommend! Thanks Nicole

name: The Wylder
address: 501 W Broad St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Absolutely fantastic!  Service is exemplary; food is exquisite (make sure you try the mushroom toast- even if you don't like mushrooms! It's to die for!) and atmosphere is fresh and comfortable.  One of my absolute favorites!  Lunch or dinner- YUM!!!
Love the Honey Badger pizza. I picked up one on my way out of town to bring home. Home is Idaho Falls it is that good. Highly recommend it. Great customer service also.

Me and my wife absolutely loved this little place. First off, the atmosphere inside is really comfortable and inviting. It's very clean and the staff is really friendly, the waitress paid a lot of attention to us despite the place being busy. We ordered the Margherita pizza and it was delicious. The crust is thin but not too crunchy and the flavor was just amazing. The drinks we had were also great and we both definitely will be coming back here.
Love this place. clean,  and great service,  love the food.  Me and my husband do our dates here. Really fun place to go. I tell people about this place all the time
Healthy well prepared meals. However, the savory foods did have sweet sauces added, which should knock off 1/2 star.

name: The Brickyard
address: 601 W Main St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: This place is amazing. Please do try any of their steaks and you will thank me. Service was second to none. They offer table side salad and have great selection of wines. If you are thinking about a good place to eat I decided for you.

We dined on a Friday night. The gentleman playing the piano was wonderful and added to our experience. Andrea, our waitress was fantastic and gracious with our questions. The french onion soup, salad with huckleberry vinaigrette, salmon, filet minion, and huckleberry cobbler were all amazing! We will definitely be going back!

I can't say thank you enough for the more than accomodating service and exceptional food we got tonight!  So very thankful I came across this restaurant on our quick overnight in Boise.  We were desperate for a meal, and several other restaurants turned us down, because it was too close to 8pm.  The Brickyard was MORE than happy to help us, and we had outstanding food in record time.  This restaurant definitely knows the secret to survival during these very difficult business times.  I look forward to dining in, someday in the (hopefully near) future.  The grilled cheese salad will definitely stick in my culinary memory bank!!

Was able to go to the Brickyard for Valentines Day 2020 and it was a really wonderful experience. The special, while rather expensive, was a creative and interesting meal that was truly fantastic.
The staff was friendly, welcoming, and really added to the overall experience. The live music was the perfect volume and created a ambiance and atmosphere that made the evening very special.
Loved it! The food was so tasty, melt in my mouth flavor. Semi formal atmosphere and dueling pianos! We will be back.

name: Trillium Restaurant
address: 245 S Capitol Blvd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Stayed at the hotel for work and had lunch. The Cajun shrimp mac n cheese is delicious. It's creamy and spicy, so be warned. I had 5 pretty good size pieces of shrimp, there are cheese curds in there. I think there were onions and some mushrooms and some other things. You can see the big burnt cheese Texas toast. It was awesome. Recommend!

Trillium ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Located inside the grove hotel in downtown Boise, Trillium is the newest incarnation of the hotel's restaurant. Three friends and I made a dinner out of appetizers on 7/15/19.  I appreciated the creative menu  and look forward to returning to try an entrée.  The service was excellent!  If you eat inside the restaurant and do valet parking, you can park free of charge for three hours.

We stayed at the Grove for our anniversary and chose to return to Trillium because of the brussel sprouts! We've been once before and they are my favorite! The apricot glaze makes them so very good. I've had pizza and it's good. Saturday I ate fish and chips and the portions are big! The bartender made my drink perfectly! We will be back!

Exceeded my expectations. I've been to a few similar (priced) restaurants in Boise and this is one of my favorites. I got an excellent Cobb salad, and I was told the smoked chicken salad was better. The Mac and cheese was pretty good. The sandwiches our friends got we're large and good. The brussel sprouts starter was excellent.

I guess this restaurant deserves four stars, maybe. With a reservation, we awkwardly walked into an empty restaurant at 8:30 on a Thursday night. There was no way I was eating in an empty, cavernous room.  The maitre d' allowed us to grab some menus and sit at the lobby bar. The people at the bar were all there on business, forlornly sitting by themselves. The service behind the bar seemed college young and was pleasant enough, but there was a concrete lack of sophistication.

Portions were huge, fit for a nose guard.  The short ribs and bison meat loaf were both monstrously good, as was the wedge salad.  I was just expecting high end, and a level of class that was not evident in the Grove Hotel.  I could have been in a sports bar in Fort Wayne, Indiana. With my expectations dashed, but my stomach full, we hurried back to the Inn at 500 Central on this bone chilling night.

name: Wild Root Café
address: 276 N 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: If you are hankering for a fantastic brunch and have anyone with allergies this place is fantastic.  The Tofu scramble is something to leave you wanting more and with many alternatives to milks and cheeses it is a vegan delight to visit here.  And to Those who are carnivorous the steak and eggs was absolutely adored by my partner.
Loved the taste. Tried items both breakfast and lunch menu. Prices are around $12 average. Always leave feeling full and satisfied.  (Try the stuff you don't think you'll like and surprise yourself)

Clean restaurant and great service. The food presentation is beautiful and tastes just as good. I had the bruschetta and was very happy with it. My husband enjoyed the Roast beef sandwich. We also had the Nourish Bowl, which I felt could have used a little more of the vinaigrette. I also really enjoyed their coffee.

I was in Boise for a conference. This restaurant was  found on a morning stroll. Wonderful breakfast🔥. Migas was absolutely delightful. Staff was was quite nice and the food came out fast. Great location
Great food and options to turn each menu item into vegan! Friendly staff and in a great central downtown location with lots of public parking available.

name: Richard's
address: 500 S Capitol Blvd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Wonderful flavor combinations. The wait staff was very knowledgeable.  Our waiter described every dish in detail. Definitely coming back.
First time at Richard's. Breakfast was very good, the service and ambiance great for a Sunday morning. My new favorite breakfast restaurant in Boise!

My husband and I just had a lovely Valentines Day here tonight! All the food and service was top notch, especially for this affordable price range. There was a desert special that was particularly good! Thank you Richards for an awesome experience. We will be back!

Richard's is a top-notch Italian restaurant in Boise. For several years it was in a different location, and now it is attached to the new Inn at 500 hotel.

We tried some of their signature entrees, including cannelloni and chicken with forty cloves of garlic. The cannelloni was some of the best I have ever ordered in a restaurant. The garlicky chicken was moist and extremely flavorful! The service was great; our server Shana did an amazing job! 

The ambiance and atmosphere was classy and upbeat with a full house during dinner time.

I plan to definitely go back to Richard's any time I return to the Boise area.
Great atmosphere and food. Had great service and they took exceptional care of us for even the smallest on inconveniences. I was really impressed for my first visit and we will be back. Thank you ❤️.

name: Cottonwood Grille
address: 913 W River St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: My now fiance proposed to me here on New Years Eve this year and they were just so amazing. The food was delicious but they went above and beyond to help make it special and a secret from me. My sister and brother in law dressed up in ridiculous outfits to get pictures and after we had drinks near the bar. I was truly in awe of everything, the people here were so nice. We are highschool sweethearts and after 11 years this was just the perfect place for him to propose 😭🥰❤

Brought my parents here for their 50th Anniversary. The food was amazing, Sea bass, Steak. Chicken all of it. Loved the French onion soup and the creme brule..
  The appetizers were good, but the crackers seemed pretty generic. It could have used more meat and cheeses. Besides that it was great.  Loved the atmosphere.

To be fair,  we only ordered dessert.   The staff was attentive and friendly.   The bread pudding was ok.   It seemed a little dry on top.   The bottom was delicious and moist.   The berry cobbler was good but more cobbler crust was desired.

My husband had the elk for dinner. Amazingly good! Very flavorful but not "gamey"; tender and juicy. We also ordered the Morel Mushrooms from McCall. The morels were plentiful and tender, however, the brown sauce was too overpowering for my preference. I had the Pappardelle with Pesto and added sauteed shrimp. Absolutely fabulous. It had ribbons of zucchini and arugula which made it less heavy than a full pasta dinner. I had plenty left over. Lovely setting - cool and quiet inside at 5:00 pm.

The restaurant is beautiful and romantic. I love the huge stone fire place! We were there Valentine's weekend and saw a proposal. As for the food, I wasn't impressed. This was our first time there and I did not enjoy my meal. I had the halibut and it was very greasy and I couldn't even finish it. My husband tasted it and said it was awful too. He, on the other hand, had the lamb shank and loved it. I'd be willing to try the restaurant again but I would definitely order something different.

name: Saint Lawrence Gridiron
address: 705 W Bannock St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: We happen to come across this place when looking for a place to eat lunch on our last day in Boise back in February. We had just gotten hipster t-shirts with the image of the state of Idaho, with a long beard coming out of the bottom. This place seemed like the perfect place to go next. The beef brisket sandwich with blue cheese was good. Bob also enjoyed the burger he ordered. They have a good selection of craft beer as well.

We had a slab of ribs, collard greens and cornbread. Really fantastic barbecue here. They had unbelievable smoky flavor and they were cooked to perfection. The top edges were a bit crispy and my friend wasn’t sure about that aspect but I thought it was delicious.

Came in on a Monday for lunch at 12:10pm, wasn’t super crowded (4 tables of two), server was on top of it and we ordered quickly, food was slower (out at 12:40). 
Pulled Pork Sandwich was hot and juicy. Almost too wet for the ciabatta bread. The BBQ sauce overpowers the taste of the meat, I would ask for it on the side and apply as needed. It’s delicious and pairs well. Slaw was mild and the crunch the sandwich needed! 
Fry sauce has a kick to it! My husband loved it I didn’t, but the fries are good plain. 
Overall a good BBQ restaurant with a constantly changing menu.

Food is delicious and the staff is super friendly! Love the fact that this restaurant was one of the first downtown to offer curbside to-go orders and likely the very first to offer any discount on all to-go orders several days before the Mayor of Boise shut down dine-in option for Boise restaurant. A true gem!
IMO, The best food in Boise.  If you are a foodie, you must try the brisket and the drinks are amazing.

name: Lucky Fins Seafood Grill | Boise
address: 801 W Main St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: A great deal on Sundays for sushi rolls.  Buy one get one half off all day!   Nice ambience and the new bartender was very friendly and attentive.  The sushi and service has definitely improved since we first started dining here.  Beers are a bit pricey but that’s just Boise in general these days.  Nice place for a quiet date night.

Looking for seafood or sushi in Boise? This is it. This place is fantastic. I have been here twice, and disappointment is the furthest thing from my mind. My last visit was a date night with my wife, and while there was a wait, it was worth it. This was by far one of the more enjoyable sit down meals I've had in awhile. Service, food, atmosphere was spot on. I will be visiting this business again.

Absolutely incredible food firstly...
However the environment is really what makes the experience amazing.
I snapped a few photos my last visit the other day just for it's sheer beauty and size!
It's big enough to hold a conference in the back!
The original looking deck makes it feel like you are on a ship.
Absolutely awesome place and one of my favorites!
10/10 (rare)
Very tasty variety of food to eat! A bit noise near large groups but settled down when food arrived. Nice atmosphere and good staff. Had seared Ahi and Scallops and was very satisfied.

Arrived for our 6:00pm dinner reservation and the hostess tried to seat us in the bar.  I looked in the dining area and there were two. vacant tables. I had to be insistent but got us seated in the dining area after a 20 minute wait. 

If you're looking for a quiet place to eat with your family, this place isn't it. We wont be back because this isn't the first time we've  had issues with this place.

name: Thinking Tacos?
address: 517 W Main St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: These are the best tacos you will ever try!! Every time they are at Cactus I always make sure to go! Delicious, cheap, great customer service! What more can you ask for?!
Best authentic Tacos in Boise. Awesome customer service experience, real and humble people. You can't go wrong with any of the choices they have and you must have a quesotaco!!

Since last year I have loved thinking tacos! I got a photo taken with them and gave them great advice on expanding and will forever be a customer and love they have expanded to different locations like going to the Nampa bar and also staying down town. Can’t wait to see where they go in the future. Hopefully everyone will enjoy them just as much as I have and do! Great people!
Sooo good, always satisfied 🙃 definitely will always be my number one 🌮 joint 🤤🤤
If I could 20+ plus stars I would. They make the most authentic tacos in the valley (I’ve tried and tested all the others) they rock and deserve the most credit to be honest!

name: Kibrom's Ethiopean & Eritrean Food
address: 3506 W State St, Boise, ID 83703, USA
reviews: This place is amazing! The food is wonderful and the staff is always friendly and kind. My two-year-old routinely eats far more of my food than I really want to share - I can't say enough good things about this place!
We shared six dishes, everything was delicious. Service friendly. Inexpensive. Decor minimal. Go for the food.
Great service & food. I loved everything my group ordered & the wine selection wasn't half bad either!

The waiter was very patient with me as it was my first experience with Ethiopean cuisine. He walked me through the menu and taught me the proper way to eat with injera and general Ethiopean etiquette. The food was amazing and left me satisfied but not feeling heavy. If you haven't tried it make it a point to stop by Kibrom's. My only regret is that I visited while travelling and am not close by to visit again.
It was great. It reminded me of my time in Ethiopia. I enjoyed speaking Amharic to our server.

name: Sakana Japanese Sushi Bar & Grill (S Vista Ave) 925 S Vista Ave Boise, ID 83705
address: 925 S Vista Ave, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews: Monday and Tuesday are $1 sushi rolls. There are 12 options to choose from. You get 1 bite sized roll for your dollar so order several of the same type to make your own mini roll. The food was great for a dollar and worth going back for regular price.
Monica is the best!! She always remembers my order, every little detail. She’s always so kind! The food always comes out so speedy! 12/10!
After moving from Seattle this has been my go to spot for good sushi and fun environment. I recommend you do a sake bomb while there.

I enjoyed this place and it was my first time. The Rolls were very decorative and had great flavor. I also got the vegetable udon and was impressed about the amount of vegetables but not three amount of noodles. The broth had little flavor as well until I added soy. The service was a 5 and the food was probably a strong 4.

I enjoy the variety of the menu.  Each time I've eaten there, the food and service have been excellent.  Don't let the outside fool you, the inside is beautiful.  This place is one of the Bench's little upscale secrets.

name: Owyhee Tavern - Steak and Seafood Restaurant
address: 1109 Main St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: JERRI girl we are total food connoisseurs. And we have ate at some of the top rated restaurants from the east coast to west. And we never had service like this!! We didn't have to ask for anything. You listened, you offered your opinion, and girl you hit it on the head!! 10* PERFECT service!! We are extremely picky and normally wish we would have stayed home and cooked ourselves. The Tomahawk was so tender, beautifully cooked and seasoned, never had we eaten lobster with such flavor, the crab legs were also perfect,  then you finished us off with that sweet and gooey bread pudding!! Our Valentine dinner (a day late) was better than we could have dreamed!! To the Chef, Miss Jerri and management THANK YOU!!
Went here for a work party and the food lived up to the price. I absolutely loved the tuna steaks! My wife enjoyed their Salmon burger.

Let's just say this place is awesome!  For lunch I had  the club, simply the best.  My girlfriend had the BLT.  No one left hungry, unsatisfied, but we did leave with leftovers!  The servings are generous, not a complaint at all!  They still have the best charcuterie board in Boise, and it's not on the lunch menu but they will make it on request!  Thank you for being awesome!

Great happy hour! 

The halibut is a must! Phenomenal. The plating looks kinda orange but it is the best thing I’ve tried at the Owyhee yet. 

Lunch menu is very affordable and service is speedy. If you go to dinner during happy hour the service is rather slow. Not sure if they’re understaffed or maybe someone didn’t show, but the servers worked hard.
Great staff. The happy hour is a great time to come and sit and enjoy your friends. Corner location for great people watching opportunities. Calamari was great. Drink special even better.

name: Bonefish Grill
address: 855 W Broad St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Beautiful place with delicious food. Great atmosphere and service too. We had Crab cakes- with no red pepper- my favorite! And I ordered the Bang Bang Shrimp and it was so tasty. Rich and filling. Can't wait to return and try other items!
This place was awesome. Great services. Atmosphere was good. Services was great. I went there for breakfast. Food was tasty. Dessert was delicious.
Good for lunch. Warm bread to start. Bang bang shrimp tacos never disappoint! The Asian Chicken salad was also tasty.

Amazing food and great atmosphere! My group (a party of 12) and I made reservations here. They had a table all ready for us and even when some of our party was late they understood we wanted to wait a bit and they got us drinks and amazing bread! Once we all ordered they brought all of the food out at once so that everyone was eating together. They food was amazing and everyone was pleased with their order! I will definitely go here again!

One word AMAZING!! From the ambience to the food.  We had the Lily's Chicken and the Thermidor Gnocchi. Very clean nice music. We will becoming back for sure. Thank you Ace for being a wonderful server and making our first time wonderful.

name: Elmer's Restaurant (Boise, ID)
address: 1385 S Capitol Blvd, Boise, ID 83706, USA
reviews:
This place is great!  A moderate line to be seated always means good things are in store.  Surprised the wait was only a few short moments.  

The service was second to none and the portions were exceptional!  I tried the German pancake and tossed on a side of Works hash browns.  Get both of these and you will be very happy.
Great menu, had a hard time making a decision. Food was great.  Portions are abundant and service was nothing short of top notch. Kitchen was fast too.  Two thumbs up!

Great family place to have breakfast.  My visit was on Sunday morning.  Had to wait 45 min. to be seated, but food was great.  I had the Belgian waffle with maple syrup.  I bet weekends are their busiest.
Decent food for the price. Pretty much what you would expect for a chain type diner restaurant. Food doesn't taste homemade but tastes good enough. Comfort food breakfast. Servers are very friendly!

Such a great menu and service, very friendly.  I had a large and tasty Cobb salad. My colleagues all had delicious looking food as well.  The chocolate cake was super rich and moist.  Best of all only $4, what a deal.

#travelformortals

name: Juniper
address: 211 N 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: March 13, 2020 MY BIRTHDAY DINNER❣I had 8 ladies at juniper for my birthday dinner. The round table upstairs was perfect, our waitress made amazing suggestions for all of us. We had the rosemary fries and brussell sprouts apps, I recommend the HONEY BUNNY COCKTAIL(its magic made from fairies), We had the shrimp and grits, the trout dinner, the chicken risotto, etc.  I LOVE the location and the prices❣ Ill be back to try the MOLLY RINGWALD COCKTAIL❣ Thank you guys for making my birthday dinner amazing❣

Delicious! Yummy drinks, happy hour 2 for 1 wooohooo! 
Ashley is a wonderful server! We had a great 1st time :)

We had a great brunch at Juniper! 
The food was delicious, well prepared with quality ingredients. The fresh squeezed oj and the coffee were hits as well. Good service. Wonderful meal in a warm setting in downtown Boise!
Great place to have a cocktail.  Salad Gold martini is never a letdown!  Love going here.

Good happy hour, they recently changed it and I actually liked their old menu more, which is why the 4 stars instead of 5. Overall I like the atmosphere and selection of food and drink. Looking forward to the next visit

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
address: 800 W Main St #110, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Nobody does a dining experience better than Ruth Chris. Every summer I make this my last stop for my vacation. Expect a dinner experience to run about $70 per person on average. The service is top notch and if you make your reservations online you can tell them if you are coming for a special occasion. They put flowers on the tables for anniversaries, decorate desserts with messages and your waiter will know your names and why you are out on a date. There is a bar area and a section for large groups. I'll be back next year!

This restaurant is a class act! We arrived early, then decided to go on a walkabout. Once we returned, we were seated and catered to until the moment we left! Staff was supreme! Food was excellent! Even the dessert was good, but I did tell our waiter I think I like my peanut butter ice cream pie better! 🤭 To that, I will be taking two pieces down to them, maybe this weekend...it's what I do!
Thanks, Ruth's Chris Steak House ❤️
I've always really liked them but have lost all respect for the Organization. Even though they are returning the money, they never should have received it. I will stick to more deserving places.

A very nice atmosphere, quiet and relaxing, for my first time here. Food was not only delicious, but good sized portions. My steak was a perfect medium rare. The staff were all friendly and prompt, especially our waiter. They made sure my parents enjoyed their anniversary.
Always a nice and fun experience. Tried the blue crab tower app and it's like having sushi! So yummy and refreshing; you literally feel so healthy eating it.

name: The Melting Pot
address: 200 N 6th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: The melting pot is a wonderful place for a night out. On the pricier end of Boise dining, it's well worth it for a special night out. Sign up for their fondue club and get coupons for free chocolate dipped strawberries and heads up about special events and dining opportunities. The choices are diverse, you'll definitely fine something you like; or just go for dessert! The staff are fun and engaging and can make suggestions if you gets stuck in all the choices.

Everything was superb from the service of the kind wait staff to the food and the experience. Was the meal I just had worth almost $300 for two people? Not quite. Well the selection of dippable options is almost unending, The quality left something to be desired. For the same price there are steakhouses downtown that I would rather eat at.

Wow, this place is the worst value for the money I have ever experienced. The portions are small, so be prepared to have a burger on the way home. The 30 bucks worth of meat you get arrives as 6 little cubes of 3 kinds of whatever you pick. But if you pick any of the flavored cooking methods, it all tastes the same. They even give you dipping sauces for the meat, which is a clear sign that it's a low cut of meat. It was an experience that I'm glad I don't have to repeat.

We went the day after Valentine's Day, we were so excited to try this place. There were 4 of us so we had a table with two burners. We were not greeted by or sever for about 10 minutes after being seated, she then came by and took our drink order, it took about 15-20 minutes to get our drinks. Once we ordered and they brought the cheese out the server has to make each at the table, the first cheese took forever, then the second pot of cheese wasn't melting, we checked the burner and it wasn't on. She said it was unplugged, which is below the table on the wall by the floor, she had us, the guests, go below the table and plug it back in. The cheese chose took over 30 minutes before we could even eat it due to the slow cooking and slow server,i even offered top help stir the cheese pits for her as she was so slow ans we were tired of having the server stand at or table making small talk. We ordered another drink, the salads came, our drinks were still empty. Finally i found another server and asked for our drinks, the manager came over and apologized for the wait, said she is assigning  us a new server and that this round of drinks would be on them. We appreciated this. The new server was very nice and seemed much better than the first. We had now been there 2.5 hours when he brought out the pots for dinner. The food was great once we got it. It then seemed like we never saw our waiter again. He took our dessert order but by this time we had been there 3 hours and we had to get home to relieve the baby sitter. I asked to speak to the manager as we never saw the server again, he apologized for the wait and i said we just want to close out and get the dessert to go. He got us the dessert tip go and gave us $20 gift cards for our next time in. We will never be back after that. We arrived at 7:15pm and left at 1030pm.
So delicious! It's a great place for a fancy dinner date. Plenty of time to talk.

name: Certified Kitchen and Bakery
address: 1521 N 13th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: This is one of the best coffee/ bakery/ breakfast/ lunches places in town. They have an excellent selection of baked goods as well as great coffee- not always easy to find. In addition, they have breakfast and lunch options. And the location is a great place just to explore and hang out.

There are so many great cafes in Boise now, but this is my first choice every time I’m looking for a coffee, bakes good, or breakfast sandwich - if I’d ordered more, I’m sure those things would also be my new fav 😁 I think I’ve ordered every coffee on the menu and honestly I can’t pick a favorite!

Best breakfast sandwich in town. No contest. The scratch made english muffins are perfect. Buttery, crispy, fluffy and airy all at the same time. I almost didn't write a review because I don't want to have to wait in a long line there.
Had an amazing sandwich here with my grandpa for the first time a few days ago. More importantly they had one of the best slices of apple pie I have ever had!

If you only have breakfast in one place in Boise, make sure it’s here!! While the seating area inside was quite small and tight, the wait and crowds are soooo worth it! 

We got to try several dishes while there and only have one serious regret: not buying. Dozen sourdough English Muffins to take home with us. 

Their special “egg/arugula” muffin was something from a dream!!

name: Reef
address: 105 S 6th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: The vibe is great. I actually came here for a live show. It was great. Drinks are good. Great prices. Second time here was with my girlfriends for my bday food was so good. I also had the fish bowl drink and it was big and perfect for my bday.

Food was great.  Had the nachos as an appetizer. They were amazing.  Nice cozy atmosphere. Voodoo fries are described as spicy.  Give them a try. They are super mild.  The steak tacos on the other hand do have a little spice

Best place to see reggae bands in Boise.  Lots of high quality national bands roll through this place including some in the past who now headline Red Rocks (Stick Figure).  The food is great, staff is friendly, and the mojitos are amazing.  Plus a sweet rooftop tiki torch bar.

Super fun atmosphere, amazing food. Forbidden nachos that are to die for! Our server, Nikki, was super attentive and helpful! Love the vibe and the live music! Would definitely recommend checking this place out.

What a fun atmosphere filled with delicious food and drinks. The happy hour there is off the hook. We ordered the mondo pupu platter and were presently surprised at how much food we got.  We will definitely be back!!

name: Lock Stock & Barrel
address: 1100 W Jefferson St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews:
I LOVE this place!!! Incredible service, the food was freaking fantastic, the drinks... are still kinda with me...
I traveled over 1600 miles to eat here & it was worth every step of the way!! 💜💜

I have diet restrictions as does my mother. We ordered simple pieces of grilled chicken (which I will add that they were tremendous); but to charge $25 dollars for a little piece? Not to mention say that they could’ve fixed the problem AFTER they took my payment. Restaurant was fine and all, but not worth $25 to get a small piece of chicken again...sorry too overpriced guys.

The food was good, the service very good...but...My wife ordered her steak well done.  I know chef's hate to prepare beef this way, but they are not the one who will eat nor pay for it.  Do what the customer requests.  Her steak was closer to what I'd call medium...still slightly red in the center.  Well done means brown throughout...no pink at all.
Perfected classics with depth of flavor. Great salad bar and sourdough rolls too! The sirloin steak was juicy and highly recommended!

This was my first time eating here and I had the 14 oz ribeye and the salad bar. I did like the chicken soup from the salad bar it was very good. The steak was very moist but lacked flavor. I had to put a lot of salt on it to enhance the steak. The lunch price for a 14 oz steak was $28 and dinner prices are a lot more. I felt for the price the flavor should have been a lot better for the steak. Also for the price there was really only one side. I paid $2.50 extra to have the salad bar. Otherwise my steak would have only come with either a salad or fries or soup. I think salad and a potato should be a standard side dish for these with no extra charge. $28 is more than enough to include those sides. A baked potato was an upcharge. I will try this place again and hopefully it's better next time.

UPDATE: I went back and had the prime rib dinner and I really enjoyed it. It was so much better and had great flavor. It seems to be very popular. But they did a great job with the flavor. I will come back to have this meal again.

name: Andrade's Restaurante Mexicano
address: 4903 W Overland Rd #4903, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews: Wow! I have heard that the food here is really good so we decided to have dinner at this restaurant. We were not disappointed. The menu had a wide variety of scrumptious looking foods. It was difficult to narrow down the choices, everything sounded wonderful. Our server was great, she was friendly and accommodating. When the food arrived it looked and tasted fantastic, huge portions too. I find myself thinking about the good food and I plan to get back there soon. You should try it too.

Andrade's ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
This Boise Mexican restaurant near the corner of Overland and Orchard has a far more complex menu than most. Despite a few glitches, KM and I enjoyed our meals so much on 7/21/19 that we may have to re-think our bias re: the best Mexican food is in Canyon County. Andrade's is planning to move to a new location on Overland Rd. that will double their floor space to over 6,300 sq. ft., hopefully in Dec. 2019. Both of our dishes came with seasoned potatoes that were so delicious, we each ordered two additional sides of potatoes to take home with us. The rice was an add-on. The salsa was excellent. Highly Recommended!!!
They happily had my food ready faster than expected. Fast, friendly service at a very affordable price! The food was delicious! I will be going back again 😊

A great Mexican restaurant in the heart of Boise.  I had an enchilada combo that was perfection. 3 different types of enchiladas and a flauta. The chips and salsa was recognizably homemade and delicious.  The desserts were sweet and delicious.  Many choices of beers and wines as well.

This was my first time dining at this restaurant. The atmosphere was very inviting, friendly staff and employees would come check on us regularly to make sure we were ok with the drinks and as well when we got our food. Everything was delicious and the portions were plentiful. I would recommend this place and I will be returning to try some different stuff. The only thing that was a little frustrating was the time it took to get one of our drinks,  for mine was about 10 min and for my friend was a good 15 or so. Really didnt have time to enjoy them before the food came. All in all a very nice restaurant

name: BACON
address: 121 N 9th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Oh man if you love brunch and bacon this place is so good.  I got the BLT with salt and pepper fries, YUM! Also got the bacon sampler, it was definitely worth it.  Got a couple of mixed drinks that were great with brunch.  You really can't go wrong here.  The staff was super nice and helpful.  Can't say enough good things.  Just go eat here!

This was our first visit here, on a Saturday around 10, we came in to try the Bloody Mary. Delicious!!! The mix was perfect, didn't taste overly tomatoey.  The food was excellent, large portions, three of us split our meals. Service was excellent, so you walk in, order in the back, they shout out whenever someone orders a Bloody Mary, you grab your water and silverware and find a table, they do have outdoor seating that is heated, indoor the tables are farm style and super cool. They will bring your food out to you.  Service is fast, prices are responsible for downtown Boise. They have cards on the table with questions and trivia to pass the time. Great crowd as well.  The staff is friendly and always moving. Great place to grab a bite, they do close at 3:00 on Saturday. We enjoyed the bacon sampler. We will be back!
The spicy bacon Bloody Mary is a must here! Everything our table had was fantastic. I don’t know what they put in their gravy but it’s to die for.

Bacon is awesome. This place has great breakfast. I had their special for the day waffles with bacon and eggs, it was delicious. Had the Chai tea too and it was yummy can’t wait to go back. The environment is very relaxing as well.

Food was really good and came out faster than our wait in line. We went on a Saturday for brunch and it was quite bumping. Flavor profiles were fairly balanced for the Bacon Lasagna and Arkansas entrees we had. The Lavender Fizzy Gin (or something akin, I can't fully remember the name) was light but you could still taste the Gin come through. Thoroughly enjoyed!

name: LongHorn Steakhouse - Curbside To Go Available
address: 7997 Franklin Rd, Boise, ID 83709, USA
reviews: Guys, I know it’s a (fake) quarantine, but tonight’s to go experience was just unacceptable. I was quoted 15 minutes of wait, it ended up being 35 minutes. Okay fine. We ordered our steaks medium rare: one ended up medium well, and the other was beyond well done. I ordered a large Caesar salad, and we got a side Caesar. There were multiple things you were out of. Again some grace is allotted here but overall this is not what I drove 40 minutes one-way to deal with. This was very disappointing and we probably should have just picked up locally instead.

Great food and ambiance!  Service could be a little better.  They never cleared our app plates & had to ask for bread twice.  Drinks were timely and servers are very friendly.  This was during weekend lunch.  I will definitely be back!

My husband and I came here for a date night for the first time last night, and we were extremely impressed! We don't go out for steak often as is so expensive, but they have some delicious affordable options. We got two entrees, some beer, and desert for 50$.

Not to mention we had a great time. Setting wasn't too dark, and it was loud but not loud enough that we weren't able to hear each other. The food was amazing, I didn't even have a single complaint! This was the first time in my life I had a restaurant who cooked the steak PROPERLY, makes all the difference.

I highly recommend this restaurant if you haven't been. Our Waitress as well (Ainsley G.) was very sweet and accommodating. 100% would go here again!!!

This is a great steak house with all the steak house things you might expect. The one thing that makes them stand out is the amount of seasoning on there food. It really jumps out at you in a great way. I would advise you to ask for lightly seasoned French fries if you get them. They can be a bit overpowering. Service has been incredible on both of my visits.

The steak here is delicious the first time I came this place barely had opened the steak was way too salty for my taste and overcooked for what I had ordered. I gave it a while before I gave it another chance or was set in my review and oh my goodness I’m def coming back! The steak was perfect and juicy this time no wonder it’s so hard to get seating. The customer service also was good it could have been better but it was swamped so it’s understandable. All in all def recommend and def coming back!

name: Kyoto Japanese Steakhouse
address: 6002 W Fairview Ave, Boise, ID 83704, USA
reviews: Great place to eat.  A bit on the pricey side for dinner but fun and enjoyable to have your meal cooked in front of you.  Very good chefs who have a sense of humor and keep the table entertained and engaged.  They’ll build an onion volcano for you on your birthday.   Yum yum!
This is an amazing place the cooks are funny and excellent at what that do. Awesome place to take the family. You get what you pay for. Delicious food and wonderful entertainment.

Great food and service. I really like the options of sushi or the table side presentation I am the only one in family who will eat sushi so we can get food here that pleases everybody. I have been with a group as large as 30 and as few as 2 of us. No matter the size of the group service was awesom
By far the best sushi in Boise. Have been coming here for 15+ years, and their service and food quality has not declined at all!
Went here for Valentine's Day and it was perfect! We were put at a table with 2 other couples and everyone was so great. Staff was so funny and friendly. This is one of my top picks in Boise.

name: Chapala Mexican Restaurant
address: 1201 S Vista Ave, Boise, ID 83705, USA
reviews: Didn’t get to take a picture before I ate my burrito, it was just too darn good!!!! This is hands down one of the best Mexican restaurants I’ve ever been to. The staff made sure our tostadas were warm, and my burrito was delicious and was made to perfection. We received our food FAST and I’ve never received service so fast and so great like here. Highly recommend!!!

We had a great lunch today. Enchaladas, chicken of course, beans, rice and extra chips and salsa with guacamole were delicious. Glad we could have our favorites to go today. Thank you for being open for us!

Excellent restaurant with great tasting Mexican classics! The service was friendly, fast, and accurate. The people that work here are exceptional and really care about your experience. They treated me very well. The food was fresh and tasty! I got the chicken fajitas and I loved it. The menu is very big - if you've got a large group, I'm sure everyone will find something appetizing from all the options. I definitely recommend checking out Chapala if you're in the area and you're craving Mexican food!!

If you love dry, flavorless food covered with cheese, lettuce and tomato to mask the lack of authenticity, then come eat here. The food was sub-par. The chicken was dry and flavorless, it came in a generic hard shell loaded with lettuce cheese and tomato. Always be aware that if you want authentic Mexican food and you see Lettuce, Cheese and tomato, it’s not authentic. The beans were very good and the rice so-so. Price $11.99

My GF ordered chicken tacos (generic hard shell) and an enchilada. She asked for Mole sauce -add$1. I tried it, it was horrible, tasteless and undercooked and the sauce was out of a can. Cost $12.
