Take the time to read the 1 star reviews. I’m not going to bash this place but the food wasn’t good at all. You’re better off with Taco Bell or Del Taco.

Love the service and the food AMAZING... by far my favorite Mexican Restaurant in town.
Thanks Maria and Moises you guys are AWESOME!

name: Bar Gernika
address: 202 S Capitol Blvd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Very tasty food at reasonable prices. Expect to wait for seating,  but it is worth it! I had the lamb stew - very tasty.  Don't miss the  croquetas. Great draft beer options

Fantastic place! Found this little gem on Diners, Drive-ins & Dives site = so happy! Delicious Basque food - had spicy lamb grinder with homemade croquetas + a fairly local IPA. Attentive prompt service + jam packed by 6pm by locals in the know.

A must see while you are in Boise.  The heart of the Basque block, Bar Gernika has a delicious menu, good tap selection, a fun space and great service.  Everything on the menu is delicious but the apple and cheese plate with some Basque beer is a great way to warm up to the evening or finish it off.
This was good! Chill atmosphere and laid back food. The croquettes were to die for! Sandwiches are large and flavorful. Try the brown spicy sauce!

Quintessential Boise, a must visit at least once but we have been here many times. Always fun, good service, good food, good drink choices. Historic setting in the heart of downtown. Try everything on the menu !

name: Diablo & Sons Saloon
address: 246 N 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Service was slow- feed the meter at least 2 hours for dinner. Great pork chop! Interesting unique decor we ate in the Rabbit room. I will be back to try the tacos my son had!

Stopped in for a drink with a friend, but ended up staying for dinner. The service was excellent, and our waiter went out of his way to make sure what I was ordering could in fact be made vegan before taking my order! 
The taco menu offers many vegetarian options that can all be made vegan by removing the dairy items. I started with the crispy Brussels sprouts, which came with a caramel sauce. Even with the sauce they were vegan - and so, so good! I did 3 of the vegetarian tacos with no cheese or dairy sauces, and all of them were fantastic! The potato taco was my favorite. Top it off with great drinks and a fun atmosphere, this place is a gem and I will be back!

Great atmosphere! We really enjoyed coming down and hanging out at the bar. The bar service was quick to serve our beverages whenever we wanted something. The food was a little slow coming out but well worth the wait. I'm pretty sure they forgot about my tacos since they didn't come out until after our other dish was gone. The staff were awesome though and comped the tacos since they took so long. Make sure to try the Diablo Saloon hot sauce, good stuff. We will definitely be back.

Great tacos and apps in a old western inspired setting. Really unique setting on restaurant row in downtown Boise. Food was cooked on an fire grill behind the bar. Huge beer, wine, and cocktail menu. And awesome service! Overall, really impressed with this place!

I'm from South Texas, so I was already a tad skeptical about the quality of the tortilla that would be served to me. I was wonderfully surprised! Perfect tortillas wrapped around perfectly prepared catfish! Order any appetizer, it won't disappoint. I ordered a Lemonade cocktail, that I sent back...it just wasn't for me, but they gave me no trouble about it! Great place!

name: Mai Thai Restaurant
address: 750 W Idaho St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: If you are in Boise and looking for good food and cocktails, this is an outstanding choice. Separate vegan menu? Yes, and it's on the front page. Great tiki cocktails? Yes, they have that also. Plus warm, friendly service and when the menu says spicy they mean it. Added bonus: they serve food until 10 PM on weeknights.
The roasted duck and pork belly was a guilty pleasure but worth it. This restaurant offers up lots of great cocktails and food. The decor and atmosphere makes you come back for more.

This place is absolutely amazing! They have one of the most diverse vegan menus in Boise, and the food does not disappoint! I had the yellow curry and the Tsing-a-song roll! Both of which were scrumptious and bursting with flavor. We also ordered the mango sticky rice, expecting a scoop of over-sweet glop in a bowl, but it was AMAZING. It comes in a banana leaf and it's warm, sweet, and comes with fresh mango and some sort of blue sauce (seriously, what is in this stuff- it's so good, I would bathe in it)! I will definitely be back!

Mai Thai restaurant is a favorite of ours.  The food is terrific and service courteous and prompt.  

A long-time resident of Boise and having lived and worked in Thailand for ten plus years, I would rate Boise's Mai Thai food as good as, or better than, most of the Thai restaurants we frequented while living in Thailand.  

Not a brag, just cold hard facts.  

The only Thai restaurants in Thailand as good as Boise's Mai Thai would be those in Thailand serving fresh caught seafood and those would be hard to beat just about anywhere.  

Ray Toronjo
Ordered through DoorDash, was so excited to try the half duck! The taste was good however the ”half” duck was more like 1/4 of duck. It was like there were missing pieces

name: Taj Mahal of Idaho
address: 150 N 8th St #222, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: WOW! ⭐ Taj Mahal of Idaho easily has the best food and dining experience I've seen in Boise. What was intended to just be a nice dinner for my girlfriend and I ended up being a romantic evening full of smiles. We were charmed by the owner who took the time to explain what  the exotic foods on the menu were and answer all of our questions. Even being our first time trying Indian Cuisine they still made us feel at home and part of the culture. If you're looking for a fine dining experience without the overpriced menu, give Taj Mahal a shot!

All I can say is you gotta witness this for yourself. Great family owned restaurant in the valley. Feels like they bring unique flavors straight from the Indian Subcontinent. They do not use any artificial flavors or colors in their food. The family is very nice. Service is excellent. It can get a little busy so definitely would recommend making a reservation.

I recently tried Indian food for the first time in Dallas, TX. I can not get enough of the spices and flavor. Taj Mahal in Boise is by far the best I have experienced. I can’t wait to go back for more and more. We were lucky to meet the family who own and run this fine establishment tonight. We are so honored to have them in our town.

Staff and especially the owner are very friendly and lively. It's always a pleasure to go here and chat with them. Their food is the best Indian food I've had in the treasure valley. I've tried many Indian cuisines and restaurants alike in the area and they just aren't as good as Taj Mahal. These guys are amazing and their food matches it every bit.

Excellent food, generous portions. We ordered two entrees and got much more food than two people have business eating. We tried goat for the first time and enjoyed it. The paneer was done perfectly, soft, but with just a little bit of crispiness on the outside, and good flavor. The service was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere nice.

name: The Matador
address: 215 N 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: Went out with the extended family. They got 8 of us seated really quickly and the service was good. It was a little warm in there, making the ice melt in the glasses. We also ordered the guacamole and it was really good. We'd definitely go back.

The grilled jalapenos here will bring me back everytime! They are so amazing, add that to everything else I've tried on the menu and this place is a solid choice. Lunch or dinner you will not be disappointed!

I love Matador's free chips and salsa, as well as their food and drinks menu. I really wish this location would get blenders so they can make the frozen margaritas like the Meridian location. Other than that, I love this location.

I highly recommend trying one each of the street tacos. Also, try to come during happy hour for the best deals.

Many tables available on a Saturday night at 6:45 pm but there was a 45-minute wait... Surprisingly we got sat in 20 min. The waitress was great, food was absolutely delicious. I got the chicken Verde burrito and my husband ordered the NY Strip fajitas. Yummy

Yummy Mexican food, nachos are massive! A wide variety of cocktails. Seating inside and out, the downtown area can get busy so there might be a little bit of a wait. Service can be slow but they don't rush you.

name: Meraki Greek Street Food
address: 345 S 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: We ordered for pick up and it was SO delicious that I had to fight the kids to get a bite. Seriously try the feta fries!!!  My husband had the lamb gyro and said it was super tasty.  I had the Souvlaki plate with chicken that was super flavorful and loved that the chicken wasn't dried out.  Their pita is super soft and the sauces very taste.
Quick service, good food and lots of choices. The fries were seasoned really well. The chicken gyro was tasty and well made. Nice presentation and ambience, good staff too.

Food was alright. Received wrong order the first time but was fixed right away.  Everything just seemed way too salty. I probably won't eat here again. I think Gyro Shack is much better and even Arby"s has better gyros. Fries were good.

This place is awesome. A girl helped me. She was super nice. Not sure what her name was. She had red hair. She was great. Definitely made the experience worth it. Will be coming back. Also the food was awesome.
Absolutely delicious! We went in with our 3 little boys and everyone was beyond satisfied. The food was fresh and super tasty! I love good Greek food and this place nailed it.

name: Front Door
address: 105 S 6th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: We have always loved this place! Our last visit (3-6-20) was the worst we had. First of all we ordered an appetizer which came after we got our main meal. The server made us feel that we had to take it, since we ordered it. Anyway, it appears the quality of food has gone down hill along with the service. My wife's cocktail  was wrong on the bill, so we do not know if it was the correct price.  I would have expected them to remove the cost of the appetizer or offer a free beer or something.... There was no apology or anything. Do not know what has happened there, but we will be spending our money at other places. All we were doing was looking to have a nice meal, which did not happen.

The Front Door is a hidden gem in downtown Boise. The ambiance and vibe of this little pizza place is the perfect spot to enjoy some great food and friendly service. The food is very consistent and always delicious. Their beer selection is very diverse and rotates regularly so you can always find something new to try. They also have a full bar! I'm never disappointed when I grab a bite at Front Door!

Went there for a special birthday lunch with friends.  The food was amazing.  I had the coconut curry special and it was perfectly seasoned.  The wait staff was quick and courteous and met all our needs. This place is a downtown favorite of mine because of the food, the staff, and the ambiance.

Low key the best pizza in Boise. Plus, a nice selection of beers and sours. If you're willing to wait, they'll start slinging slices after 9pm. Couple slices and a beer and there's your Saturday night.

I was in Boise on business and just happened to walk by this place. My first impression was not one of a pizza place. I saw just another bar slinging microbrews and passing off bar food as restaurant cuisine. At the end of my meal, I found nothing to convince me otherwise.  If you can put yourself in this mindset Front Door does offer slightly above average pub grub and reasonable prices. I had a cobb salad. This is my go-to meal when on the road and in a new place. The service was quick and the meal enjoyable. Overall I found Front Door a nice enough place for either a quick meal or a place to hang out and have a few drinks.

name: Waffle Me Up
address: 204 N Capitol Blvd, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: We enjoyed our breakfast here in a Sunday morning. Our children loved the waffles, which were dough instead of batter (like real Belgian waffles). The waffles had a delicious flavor, and every bite was gobbled up. The eggs and bacon were good, and my husband enjoyed the coffee. It was on the bitter side for me. The children have asked to eat here the next time we visit Boise. Great service, easy to talk to downtown and fast.

Great unique breakfast food! Linked inside to Boise Fry Company. I had the Bobocado Deluxe. I wasn’t sure how all those foods would taste together, but with my first bit I thought I was on another planet. It was incredible. If you like avocado and bacon, you have to give it a try.

Enjoyed my experience here. I wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. I just ordered the original waffle, but it was there best waffle I have ever had. It was a nice atmosphere and the workers were nice. I would definitely go back again.

Blue plate is Bob Deluxe
Red plate Bobacado Deluxe

Really good waffle with the right amount of syrup and generous portions of bacon. 

Gluten free options with no up charge. 

Atmosphere connect to Boise Fry which makes its a fun and upbeat.

I really enjoyed the service, and something about it being a small restaurant brings joy. The food was amazing and I've never had anything like it before anywhere else. Highly recommend checking it out :)

name: il Sugo Restaurant
address: 904.5 W Main St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: My family and I ate here. We wanted to try a new restaurant. As we walked in to the completely empty restaurant they asked if we had a reservation. I told them no and they acted like they were doing me a favor by seating me in their empty restaurant. There were only a few menu choices. For 4 of us it cost around $65 this was without ordering any extra items and only drinking water. The salad was an extra $6. But at $18 a plate you would think this would at least include a salad. Which looking at someone else next to us who got a salad it was mostly just a pile of lettuce. But I felt like there should have been a side item included with our one entree. The food quality was mediocre. It was definitely not worth the price. All 4 of us ordered something different and we didn't like any of it. It looked like it was going to be good but was not. One item we ordered was the disassembled lasagna and really it was only just meat sauce and noodle with a small dollop of ricotta cheese and the flavor I thought was gross. I ordered a vegetable plate that had asparagus, rice and squash mixed in for $13 and I added meatballs which cost me an extra $5 for 2 meat balls that were still pink inside. The vegetable plate was okay out of the 4 meals it was the best and it wasn't anything special for $18. Another plate we ordered was the Italian sausage fettuccine and no one even ate it. We all tried it but no one liked it. It was a waste of money. The last item we got was the shrimp scampi and that barely had any shrimp and the flavor wasn't great. They are way overpriced and for that cost the meal and flavor should have been way better tasting. I absolutely think this was a complete waste of money and I will not be back. Save your time and money and just go to olive garden. You at least get soup or salad with your meal and more menu choices. Response to owner: the only thing that I agree with about you response is that I would not be back for even a free meal if it was offered. Your meals are WAY overpriced.

We tried this place out this evening and were pleasantly surprised. It’s a nice, quaint little place.

The food was really good. The sauce was loaded, it was all sauce (see picture). The butter was delicious. Service wasn’t lacking either. 

We will be coming back for sure.

We were a party of eight
and ordered several different pastas and sauces.  Everything was delicious. 
Handmade, local pasta and from scratch sauces made at the restaurant. 
I can honestly say the best I have ever eaten. 
The service was great and the
atmosphere was wonderful,
quiet and cozy. We were able to enjoy
each other and our conversations.
I highly recommend il Sugo and will definitely come here again.

I could not have been more delighted with my first dining experience at iL Sugo!!  As I walked into the restaurant, Grant and Athena greeted me as if I was walking into their home!  Everything had just the right touch-the service was gracious and efficient but not intrusive.  The decor was cozy and inviting.  I love the menu concept-fresh home made pastas with a variety of sauces to choose from.  Salads, appetizers, wine and coffee-enough choices but not overwhelming.  We were celebrating a birthday and they brought out a fabulous dessert-complimentary!

I highly recommend il Sugo-the owner and staff are sincere in their intention to provide an authentic, delicious and memorable dining experience!

Really, really enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere at IlSugo. The Tartufo pasta dish was amazing, and the deconstructed lasagna was very good. Grant knows how to create good that tastes amazing! We had this food at a catered event and had to come into the restaurant, but it was booked! We persisted, and it was worth it!

name: Bombay Grill
address: 928 W Main St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: This restaurant and it's owners and employees have always treated us like family. Their buffet is the best I have ever eaten. I have severe gluten intolerance and have never had a problem eating here. Their chai tea is the absolute best! My personal opinion is this gem will be very very missed once they sale. No one can compare with quality of food, service and the variety of amazing authentic Indian cuisine. Please enjoy their food and beverage before they sell and are gone forever. My humble opinion. Love them so much.

Went for the lunch buffet and it was phenomenal. First time really trying Indian food and I was blown away (along with everyone else in my group). $11.65 for high quality buffet food. Will definitely be back!!

The food at Bombay Grill is always dependably wonderful! In particular, I don't think I've ever had better butter chicken. The owners are gracious lovely people. Give it a try. You may find a new favorite restaurant!

Great buffet! Tastes delicious. I would rather say 4.5 stars..Though We had to ask for bread, go to fill water by ourselves..but later when I went for tea, they happily offered me tea as per my taste .. small things, but add value! Good luck!

Out of town, wandering downtown Boise. Enjoy Indian food, so I stopped for a lunch buffet to go. Good selection and reasonable price. Very helpful staff and generously gave me an extra container for yogurt sauce, plus a container of mukwas!  Food was yummy!

name: Bangkok Thai Restaurant
address: 477 N Milwaukee St, Boise, ID 83704, USA
reviews: The food is consistently delicious and they are always happy to take my custom (vegan) order.  Love the waitstaff.  Awesome food and customer service.  Did I mention that I love this place?

This is my favorite Thai place from Boise to Los Angeles! The staff is very friendly and helpful when selecting items and spice levels. The decor is simple and nice, pretty quiet dining area even with a full house. BUT the FOOD IS THE BEST!!! Everything thing I have had here has impressed and blown me away from presentation to flavor. Today I got a chicken pad Thai and beef salad. It has become a must have at least once a week for my wife and I. Keep up the great work and see you again soon.

This place is infinitely better than Pad Thai House on Overland and Fivemile. I have absolutely no idea why Pad Thai House has as many reviews as they do. Their food sucks. Bangkok Thai Restaurant on Milwaukee is the place to be.
My frequent comfort food while working in Boise. Staff always delighted to see me! That's how frequent I ate there. If you like spicy, ask for "thai spicy."

I called in an order for curbside takout tonight. They got a little slammed tonight with take orders (times are different now with only take out and no dine-in), so our order was not ready on time. However, the customer service was great, very apologetic for not being ready on time and they were really doing their best. Food was yummy and just hoping some of these dining estabishments can survive this hit to their business right now.

name: Romio's Pizza & Pasta
address: 8125 W Fairview Ave, Boise, ID 83704, USA
reviews: They never disappoint!! We ordered dinner tonight and splurged a little, no kids!! Ordered pasta, pizza, wings and garlic bread and all of it was amazing!! Support local businesses!! They are worth it.  Staff is friendly and food is amazing!!

Just randomly decided to pop in and my wife and I were so pleased! The food was so tasty! We both tried Italian food this time and we will for sure be coming back for some of their Greek dishes! Riley was our server and we was very kind and hospitable, great dining experience:)

We love to go out. Yesterday we  found this excellent restaurant which we didn’t know before. We enjoyed a delightful time there with high-qulity meal and an efficient crew and a distinguished  cuisine. We put this restaurant in our phone list  and we shall surely return very soon. We highly recommend.

Gus always has excellent food and service is superb!
Summer evenings on the patio are a marvelous way to share a meal with friends, and the background music 🎶 is great!!! Highly recommend this place!
Had pizza and a salad delivered. Absolutely delicious. Service was great and the delivery was quick. Definitely coming back, again and again.

name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store
address: 1733 S Cole Rd, Boise, ID 83709, USA
reviews: Once I got past the cool store with lots of things I wanted, the food was great comfort food.

National chain that still manages a home style feel. The portions are huge for the price and the fried chicken is worth the trip.

The store (where you enter through and have to pay your bill at) is well stocked with souvenirs that have a nostalgic and rural feel.

The service staff are very friendly and treat you like an old friend.

When they are busy (usually) you can wait on the front porch in the rocking chairs. Check with Google turn the best times to go, but my wait times have never been that bad.

Great food, great service....great everything!  What can I say? :)

I had a newbie service me.  He was so funny and nice.  Sometimes it's just nice to talk to people.  You should definitely give this place a try, if you haven't yet!  Loved it♡

Charming and nostalgic restaurant, Cracker Barrel is unique and tasty. I am a big fan of fried chicken which I have tried twice there and almost tried again. Both times it was over cooked and the breading was very hard. Didn't want to chance it again so I had chicken tenders which were very good. Excellent atmosphere and staff. Always enjoy the side dishes.
Delicious !!! Great service AND very good prices thank You

name: Flatbread Neapolitan Pizzeria
address: 800 W Main St STE 230, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews:
We went there on Saturday night. The location is great. They have seats by the open wide windows facing 8th street which we enjoyed a lot. The environment was casual and friendly and there was an authentic pizza oven at the center. Pretty cool to me plus you couldn't smell any burning oil or smoke in there which is an issue for me at indoor busy restaurants.
Our server was shaved head long bearded gentleman who gave us an extraordinary service. 
We ordered roasted tomatoes with goat cheese for appetizer which was one of the best appetizers I had so far! It is spicy hot as it should be!
The pizza was authentic and taste delicious!the ingredients were fresh!

Do not expect anything like your usual Domino's pizza. This is different!
If you feel like eating greasy salty pizza, don't go here this time! But if you feel like eating Italian pizza this is the place!

Went here for the very first time. The staff were WONDERFUL! Stopped in with no reservation before the lunch rush and since it was our first time they took us to a great view! Because we were first timers our waiter gave us the detailed low-down on what everything is in a professional friendly manner. My mother has sight problems and he was so very patient with her which I very much appreciated. My brother has social anxiety and speaks low when near many people, our waiter simply got closer and spoke to him, almost kinder I would like to say. I wish I remembered our hostess and waiters name!! Their selection of items was incredibly inclusive to those who are vegan, food allergies and of course our meat eaters! Food preparation was beautiful (not sure authentic because I'm not Italian nor know what the authentic dishes look like...) we definitely thought we didnt order enough food until we started eating! It was more than enough with left overs to take on the road! Keep up the amazing service and foods we will sure to be back!

We absolutely loved the vibe of this place! Our waiter was very friendly and quick. We ordered the Alfredo chicken pizza and it was truly delicious!! I'd say my only minor complaint was that it was super loud but it was also a Friday night and again I don't think it's meant to be a quiet sit down necessarily. Would go again!

We’ve being going to your restaurant before you moved into the Zion building and have never had a bad experience. When friends come into town, it’s the first place we think of when dining out for dinner. There are many good choices in downtown Boise and have always considered you as one of them...until last night. I’m not sure if there is new management or maybe a new cook, but when all three of our meals are not close to being the standard of what we have come to expect from Flatbread, then something is wrong. 
I had the Rosemary Chicken sandwich which is normally an extremely tasty sandwich that I always order. Last night it was very dry and unpleasantly tasteless. I did eat half of it because I was hungry. My sister-in-law had the Alfredo the Grate. It was cold and dry and had no bacon and only two pieces of artichoke. My wife had the Chicken Parmigiana which was overcooked and very greasy. 
The one bright spot was the Wood-Roasted Cauliflower appetizer. 
Overall, it was a bad experience that makes choosing Flatbread the next time we dine-out not one of our options.

Sadly my favorite pizza, the white truffle mushroom, has been removed from the menu, and I have yet to find a pizza that compares to it. I have been a regular at this place for years, for good reason. Their service is always perfect. The appetizers, drinks, and pizzas are perfect, and the location has perfect views of downtown Boise. Everything about this place is perfect. (except the empty spot on the menu where there used to be a truffle pizza)

name: P.F. Chang's
address: 391 S 8th St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
reviews: I enjoyed basically all the food. I went with a group so I/we sampled a lot of platters. Their signature salad wrap was awesome, not what I was expecting but very tasty. I enjoyed the dragon roll, better than a lot of places I've had them at. My favorite would have been the dumplings. No complaints all the way around. Great service. I thought the kids menu was a little lacking but with that being said, the kiddos were happy with their order as well.
Prices have gone up, however the food is good. I loved the fried green bean appetizer dish.

The table was sticky, either from a lack of cleanliness or the finish coming off.  Food was mediocre.  Asian Pear Mojito tasted like pure syrup.  Our sushi roll came out after we were done eating.  Bathroom is disgusting.
The place is definitely not the quality it was originally.
Only redeeming quality was our kind server and he took off the charge for the sushi roll.

It was all amazing and wonderful. It's no surprise that they are known for their lettuce wraps. They we a great starter. We had a Korean steak, and a sea bass, shared so we both got some of each. I don't usually order my steak as rare as this was (medium rare), but it was so nicely seared and marinated and had such a great sauce that I didn't mind that it wasn't quite my usual medium. The sea bass was seared just long enough to cook cook it through and the sear on ours was perfect. I'm not usually a fan of dark chocolate, but I recommend the great wall of chocolate.

The food was good, but the service was horrid. Our particular server had just come back from "vacation" and stated he wasn't familiar with 2 out of the 3 items we had questions about.  This was the special menu. He also forgot to put in an order and our appetizers came out with entrees.  
Let me be clear, it was NOT busy. He also never smiled. In my opinion a tip is similar to a commission. You have to work for it. If you are not happy with the wages, then you either work for tips to compensate with a smile, friendly service,  and menu knowledge or you get a different job. This man was not welcoming nor looking for any compensation. 

It was discouraging because the host was very welcoming, the atmosphere was calming,  and the food was good. If I go back, it will be an order to go.
